description:
I love that this place exists in the center of San Francisco. It's so convenient of a location to get work done when you need to. This is such a cool concept of a bank having a cafe and I love getting work done here. On their main level, they have a Peet's coffee if you want a snack or some coffee. 

The wifi here is fast and reliable as well! There are 3 stories and so much seating. You can sit at high tables or couches and regular tables or bean bags. Whatever you want, they'll probably have. If you're ever in the area and want a nice place to get work done around a bunch of other people who are also getting work done, this is a great motivational place to be.
author: Catherine S.

description:
I love this place so much. I moved here 2 weeks ago , live in the financial district and work from home so I thought it would be a breeze to find some cool little places to work was and boy was I wrong. I'd find a little cafe with nice lighting and.. no outlets. Or a fun outdoor location with no bathroom for blocks. .. or decent wifi and the coffee was $12. 
This place is spacious, not ever too crowded, made for working (big strip outlets on the tables) quiet but still has a buzz of background noise/music to keep you grooving through work. Plus 50% off for capital one users. If I wasn't already one they'd have me sucked into being one! 

My list of working needs: 
[x] Desks 
[x] Outlets 
[x] bathroom 
[x] Can hold a call
[o] wifi 
[x] reasonably priced coffee 

technically they do have wifi, but it hardly works. I use my phone hotspot just fine, so it's not a killer.
author: Alaura J.

description:
Pretty useless.
I wanted to open savings account for $35000 and ask them to sign a document for dmv so I will be self insured. I was told it's not a branch blah blah blah and they don't have right to sign any document and I need a branch and nearest branch is in Texas and they cannot send this document by mail (why?).
We are living in 2018, post office not invented yet.
author: Vlad S.

description:
So bummed because this is the closest place to get coffee near work. But it only takes one screw up and some attitude from a barista to get me to never come back here. Luckily there are 50 billion coffee places nearby, but to be fair I'll definitely keep coming here because any poorly run Peet's coffee is better than every Starbucks any day of the week. 

But FYI - the difference between an iced drink and a hot drink are so substantial. And after literally waiting 15 min while I watched people behind me in line get similar drinks first I'm blown away that I could get attitude when asking that my drink be iced when that's how I ordered it.
author: Jessica F.

description: It's a really nice place ,plenty of seats and charging stations.Peets coffee and snacks for purchase.I loved being able to pay card and it posted same day.
author: Terance C.

description:
Super chill spot to hang out in the middle if FiDi. It's modern, there's free WiFi, places you can plug in, and there's a fully functioning Peet's inside where you can get 50% any drink if you pay with a Capital One card. The price is taken off as you pay. So, they will say "your total comes to $3 please" and when you hand them your Capital One card, they will then say "ok, your new total is $1.50"

It has high ceilings and multiple floors, so it doesn't get too loud like other coffee shops.
author: Jessica C.

description:
The Capital One Cafe is such a cool concept. The space is inviting and fun and the people that work there are so nice.

I also went through three sessions of the free money coaching with Janaki Bakshi and I can't say enough good things about her! She's is intelligent, caring and so thoughtful. We worked through alot of things I've been deliberating and she provided incredible support and guidance. I wish I could do 3 more sessions! I have recommended her to many friends. Thanks for such a great service, Capital One!
author: Maggie R.

description:
This place is awesome! I never knew a bank could be a cafe. It's clean and has lots of space to sit and relax. 
They have free beverage days and 50% off when you use your capital one card. 
We got a quiche here. It was so good! Super flavorful and fresh. Nice and warm. 
They have a cool world map where you can put a pin where you are traveling next. 
They need to have more of this type of stuff in the USA!
author: Betty H.

description: This is one of the hidden gems to study at in sf. It gets crowded sometimes but decent sitting area with solid WiFi and plug in ports. With three accessible floors, I have always found a spot pretty easily though. The ambience is good. It quiet place to get work done and get a coffee from the Peet's coffee shop located inside. Would definitely recommend and come again.
author: Maria G.

description:
I needed a place to study because studying at home...well, let's be honest: I netflixed 90% of the time I was supposed to be studying so that wasn't working. I was debating on studying at a library but ***yawn*** - boring. 

And then Capital One Cafe comes along! My coworker told me about this cafe, and I was already so excited simply listening to her describe the space. The cafe is very open and has a lot of space to study (individual tables, sharespaces, AND private rooms you can reserve say whaa), discounted coffee/tea, free wi-fi (it's *really* slow though but I shan't complain), free waffle Wednesday's (this is pretty dope), great location near the bart, beanbag area for you to chill in. All in all, pretttttty genius of Capital One to have spaces like these all over the country.

It does suck that the cafe closes at 6 PM on weekdays - here's hoping someone from the cafe will bring that up to management so we can stay just a little bit longer.
author: Cathy C.

description: This used to be mine favourite hangout spot for coffee daily, it's spacious, comfortable with reasonable fast wifi, and right in the middle of FIDI, I'm surprised a place like this doesn't have a better security, I first noticed there were occasionally one or two interesting characters hanging around, but it wasn't enough to bother me, however these days there seems to be these mental patients permanent home. In fact, I've just witnessed as I'm writing this very review that a security guard who just walked pass these homeless people and did a sharp U turn out of here.
author: Skyler Z.

description: I wish I could give less than a star. Not only do this banks ATMS (3 of them) never work, but the customer service here is appalling. I had my card and app hacked and it has been a total nightmare dealing with this joke of a bank. THEY GAVE MY ACCOUNT INFO TO MY HACKER AFTER KNOWING THAT THERE WAS FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY!!! This bank is the worst bank I've ever dealt with. Their catch is easy and simple bank, but it has been the most frustrating and horrible experience I've ever had. I think Capital One forgot that I AM THE CUSTOMER. If you value your hard earned money and your precious time, skip these thieves.
author: Becca J.

description:
Customer service was great! They helped me with everything I needed and more. Very friendly people. They did try to swindle me with their special deals and offers though, which was a tad bit annoying, but it didn't bother me much.

My one big problem was that the rewards aren't as great as my usual go to, American Express. I didn't get as many airline miles, and reward points for each purchase. 

The interest rates were also a little lower at Capital One, which seems great to others, but for my purposes, not so much. 

All and all it's a great establishment, so long as you can suffer through all their promotional stuff when you call their support line.
author: Jim S.

description:
Great place to work! Good overall noise level (you can focus on your own work but also could take a call and not be a disturbance). Three floors with couches, tables, and bean bag seating so you can find the right vibe for you. The baristas at the Peet's on the ground floor are super sweet and the Capital One advisors just sang someone happy birthday 

Wifi can be a little spotty, but its free to anyone which is super nice.
author: Heather W.

description:
This place is a a goddamn oasis in the middle of the Union Sq. concrete jungle! And by that, you can grab pretty decent coffee, take a piss and use their wifi ... potentially all at the same time!

Seriously, it's a spacious and solid place to work and get some shit done. Did I mention it's a great place to pee while you are desperately looking for a restroom in the neighborhood?

Well played, Capital one!
author: Ki C.

description: FunCheap reported that this cafe would be giving out free coffees and Smitten ice cream on Halloween during certain hours, so I decided to take a trip downtown and I brought Zane. The ice cream was no big deal and it ran out. But the free coffee was awesome! I got an iced coffee in the biggest size. Zane got a purple tea. No complaints. Thanks a lot!
author: Denise C.

description:
Pros: Great cafe, chill space, nice people.

Cons: Internet speed needs improvement! Monday to Friday and 9-6 only.
author: Saad Z.

description:
Located near Montgomery Bart station. 

Super convenient cafe that you can get free wifi, a charge for your cell phone and some coffee and pastries at a decent price. 

I came in here to kill some time while waiting for an appointment that was about 45 minutes away from the time I walked into this cafe. I am a capital one card holder so there was definitely incentive to come in when I saw the sign outside stating if you use your capital one card, you get 50% off tea or coffee. 

It's clean. It's spacious. There's bathrooms. It's bright and there's lots of amenities to be had if you're looking for a resting place or even just a place to surf the web and kill some time. 

I ordered their iced matcha green tea - delish! Not too thick or sweet. Much better than Starbucks in my honest opinion.  

I will definitely be back again. 

P.S. All coffee and tea are provided by Peet's Coffee.
author: Ashley L.

description:
Jennifer Aniston and Friends had their Central Perk Café. I have my Capital One Cafe.

It's like family--that's all I can say.

It wasn't too long ago when I returned to San Francisco looking for a cafe to settle back into life in the developed world. The transition wasn't easy--I still wasn't accustomed to seeing colorful lines of code splattered literally in front of every open computer and conversations of the next "big thing" from every corner, but I couldn't have found a better place to settle in. The staff here is amazing--it's what they do.

From games to activities to Waffle Wednesdays, it's like you're part of a big, happy family. And I do mean "big" and "happy." The brand ambassadors are always there waiting to greet you with a big, happy smile. It helps to start off the day right.

While the staff may be the best part, there's also 50% off coffee if you swipe using your Capital One card. 3 floors of ample space...the perfect place to co-work or to meet someone for coffee...and you'll never get kicked out. 

I'd say the only negative would be the WIFI. It's slow. So if you need speed, try somewhere else. For any other purposes, it's the place to be. And...you can't beat that location!
author: David W.

description:
So much love for this place. 

In a pretentious yuppie city like SF (note: SF is where I was born and raised and I have more love for this place than anywhere in the world, but let's be real, it could not be more pretentious or yuppie), this place is a huge breath of fresh air. 

The space is HUGE with lots of plugs and tables to work. Coffee and snacks available. No one bothering you. Good wifi. Not too loud. Literally the best place to work if you actually need to get work done (vs a cute trendy environment which this place lacks being a chain Peets).
author: Roxanne A.

description:
I'm so happy that a place like this exists! It's a workspace with a Peet's coffee downstairs.

Most coffee shops are built and centered around the ordering area, but Capital One Cafe is centered around being a good workspace. The atmosphere is absolutely wonderful. There are plugs everywhere, and a variety of ways to do your work! Tall desks if you want to stand, long desks for lots of people, solo desks if you need to be alone, corners to hide in with bean bags, etc. The possibilities are endless! I love the open layout of the place too with the tall ceilings. It's three whole floors too!

Entrance is at the 2nd floor, bathroom is on the bottom floor.

Wi-Fi is free too! They also offer discounts for Capital One card users. You don't have to be one to work here, but the perks seem pretty good!

If I lived closer, I'm pretty sure I'd be a regular at this cafe. So awesome!
author: Tsyria T.

description:
Came here for an event by NAAAP (National Association of Asian American Professionals) San Francisco chapter. Peets coffee was closed but drinks were provided by the staff of Capital One (water, soda) and wine provided by Scholar Wine. Food, momos and somosas by NeWa. 

The event was called WIN! (Women in NAAAP). WIN! is a dedicated program within NAAAP that provides a platform for Asian American women to share their experiences and connect and with the wider NAAAP community. The event was a gender inclusive event. Programming included a Q&A session and networking sessions at the end.

Besides this event the Capitol One Care hosts other events through out the week.
author: Allen L.

description: 2 stars for half off discount for capital one customers.  Docked 3 stars because it took almost a half hour this morning.  When I asked how much longer I found out that my drink had been sitting there for quite some time.  I wish they would call your name and put names on cups like every other coffee place.
author: Tom F.

description:
The future of banking is here and gone are the long lines at Wells Fargo and their overpriced fees. I signed up with Capital One 360 Banking in February 2016 when I got tired of parking my savings at Wells Fargo and earning nothing but a petty 0.01%. It was insulting. I searched high and low for a bank or credit union that offered a minimum of 1%. For a bank to offer that in today's economy means no local branches and a completely online experience.

Sure, I was a little hesitant even at my age (30) to give all my money and send it "online" but I was reassured by it being Capital One and being FDIC insured. As a Capital One credit card customer for almost 15 years, I never had a bad experience with them and I was excited to move my banking with them. It wasn't until weeks after that I had my account that I noticed on their website that they had a Capital One Cafe in San Francisco, one of only 3 in California. 

Capital One Cafe is exactly what we need in 2017. Gone are the tellers and sleazy bankers and instead we have full-service ATMs, a fully functional Peet's Coffee, WIFI, and plenty of seating spread across three floors. It's welcoming as well as educational with financial workshops produced by Capital One. The bank does employ a few customer service reps to help anyone with Capital One financial products but I've never been bothered in any of my visits. It wasn't until today's visit that I explored the lower floor which has more seating and more importantly, restrooms, which I was unaware they had. 

It's hard to complain about what Capital One is doing. It's what our generation needs and they are disrupting the business of banking by going online and I welcome it. My only complaint would be the ATMs seem to be a bit on the older side and not as fast as the competition but I think they will be upgraded in due time. Lastly, you can't complain about the 50% discount at Peet's by using any Capital One credit or debit card.

Wells who?

Ambiance/Decor: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Price: $
Overall: 5/5

Pros:
+ Full-service Capital One ATMs
+ 50% off Peet's with Capital One credit or debit
+ Plenty of seating spread across three levels
+ Free WIFI
+ Private conference rooms available for reservation
+ Restrooms on lower floor

Cons:
- ATMs are older technology 
- Closed on weekends
author: Alexander E.

description:
I had a great experience last time I was in this cafe to get a help from a staff in order to transfer money. 

Alex who was one of the staffs was so helpful and professional. He kindly walked through the steps to transfer money via cashier check.
author: grace k.

description:
Hmmm....what's the catch? This is GORGEOUS space with plenty of seating, plenty of outlets, free wifi and a Peets coffee shop as well.

It's like the poor man's coworking space, if you count plush couches or new furniture as the poor man's vibe.

Seriously this place is great- the WiFi can be a bit clunky at times, but when it's free and you've got a great place to work for the day can you really complain? 

I'm sure if you're here long enough they'll approach you about a CapitalOne product but they definitely don't seem to be aggressive in any sort of way.
author: Elliott W.

description:
Latte and gingerbread 
The peet's latte is as good as always and the gingerbread is better than I expected.
The decorations are so good. It's a nice place to stay with books and food maybe works
author: Yantong Z.

description:
This is my favorite coworking space (free too!) in San Francisco. Truly it does not get any better in a City where coffee shops can get very crowded.

Pros:
-Tons of plugs. Street level, upper level, lower level (w/bean bags too).
-Plenty of space. Couches for those that want to be more comfortable.
-It's a financial institution, but they're not pushy at all. In fact, I wouldn't know it is except for the 50% Peet's Coffee sign. On Fridays from 1-2pm, there is Happy Hour. Everyone an get 50% off one drink. Capital One card holders get it for free.
-Various free financial related workshops. Special events during holidays with free cookies and ice cream.
-Decent amount of bathroom stalls.
-Peet's Coffee. You can check in w/the Peet's card.
-Takes credit card.
-Close to public transit. Montgomery Bart Station. MUNI 38, 8x, 45, 30, 2 and 3.
-Good mix of techies, writers, office crowd having lunch, and folks catching up. Some students although not a lot.
-Great place to work/remote for the day.
-Next to one of my favorite yoga studios, Ritual Yoga and bubble tea at Asha Tea.
-Friendly staff. All smiles.
-Huge open space. 

Cons:
-Closed on the weekends. Open daily M-F, but closes promptly at 6pm. They even make announcements!
-Wifi, at times, can be spotty. For the most part, it works fine although not super fast. 
-It's still an urban area so I would keep an eye out on your belongings or ask someone to watch it for you.
author: Tina C.

description: I love the concept and layout of this place! But the baristas were slow, coffee wasn't great, and the WiFi wasn't strong. I was hoping to get some work done but had to leave because of it. Not saying I wouldn't be back if I come to town again, just that it would be better with more people working (late afternoon during the week, aka coffee time, and only two people working) and better WiFi (could've been my computer but tbd).
author: Emily M.

description:
I almost don't want to write this review so that more people don't find out about this place. I just don't know what's not to like. Let's see:

- Huge, modern, clean interior
- Coffee line goes super fast (it's Peets so it's not necessarily amazing, but it's good)
- 50% off coffee with capital one credit cards
- A ton of open space (three floors), and it's never been crowded when I've been there
- Free wifi and tons of outlets for charging your laptop

This place is just the absolute go to if you need to get work done during the week. The only disadvantage is that it's not open later or on the weekends (there's just no one around the area to come in and work, I guess). I suppose you also have to deal with Capital One's capitalism running rampant in here, but that's what's paying for the place and the people around ready to talk to you about applying for a credit card are never bothersome and actually give the cafe a friendly vibe.

The best time to come is the mornings, because that's when you get the odd, comforting sort of atmosphere where people come in and finish off their morning routine by getting coffee before heading into the office. It feels calm, productive, and for some reason I like how financial and businessy the mood is.

I swear to God some people must be in here all day working on their startup, it's a really great work environment. I've been coming here on and off in the mornings for a long time and I don't see myself stopping any time soon.
author: Noah G.

description:
Peet's Coffee in the cafe - I'm usually a Starbuck's gal but Peet's has vegan coconut whip cream (+35¢). 

It can get quite loud. There are three levels. The 1st level, or the basement, is a tad quieter. They also have bean bags! The second level has the Peet's Coffee as well as tables and seating. The third level has a ton of seating and workspace but the noise tends to travel up so it can get really loud. 

The bathrooms always smell like someone took a shit. Cause someone probably did. Coffee does that to ya!
author: Jessica K.

description: Free location to hangout or do some work. The wifi is terrible but can't dock any stars since we are freeloading in sf. I suggest one to bring work that can be done offline or bring a personal  hotspot. Coffee is 50% off with capital once card but it doesn't seem like you are obligated to buy anything. Homeless was minimal when i visited. Free toilets downstairs too.
author: Spring J.

description:
Great place to work with occasional special activities and promotions. Beverage discount if you have a capital one card.

Lattes and other drinks with froth tend to be poor. Tastes too diluted with milk, and the froth takes up half the cup! Was told it was controlled by their machine so they couldn't do much to fix it.
author: Bruce L.

description:
I'm disappointed with the work atmosphere at the cafe. It's a great idea, but poorly implemented.

The aspect I have the biggest problem with is the noise. They don't have a set music station for calm background music to work to. They have an iPad, and whoever has the iPad gets to pick the music. Unfortunately, that means one person can pick party music to listen to and everybody has to listen to it. There is nowhere to hide from the music unless you have earphones and listen to your own.
I also wish they had tables that were tall enough to use as standing desks. There are some that are almost tall enough, but not quite (I'm 5'8").

Pros: free wifi, they don't make you buy a drink, relaxed atmosphere
author: Sara B.

description:
Elinor A. is on the mark here. This is a fantastic, large, airy venue at which to work or hold meetings in the Financial District. There's 3 levels at which you can spread out, with tables and counters upstairs and at ground level, and a bean bag-filled loungey area in the basement.

There's a Peet's Coffee stand to serve all your caffeination needs, and there's enough music, background noise, and video screens to keep you engaged and productive (lest you look like a slacker for being on Facebook instead of, ahem, working). There are even clean bathrooms in the basement. 

Moreover, there's never any hard sell - or any sell, for that matter - from Capital One whatsoever. How much better can a free workspace get?!
author: Vincent L.

description:
My first time at a Capital One Cafe. It's conjoined with Peet's Coffee. And offers 50% off drinks if you use your Capital One Credit Card or Debit Card. Not Bad!

But you don't have to be a Capital One customer to walk in, nor....do you have to buy anything. There are plugs everywhere and people appear to walk in and just use the facility. And restroom! A number of tables and sofas are offered as people hang out. It's normal noise level, not that many people are talking however; they seem to be busy on their laptops.

The share space, open office kind of style is really neat.

Just drop by and check it out yourself. (I just walked in, after roaming around the city....standing awkwardly as I walked the 2nd floor and back down. The bathroom in 'basement'.)
author: Thomas K.

description:
After reading Ramit Sethi's "I'll Teach You To Be Rich," I immediately went and did research on ING's online savings accounts. I found out Capital One bought them a few years ago, so I just opened an account with Capital One! 

I've met up with my friend Peter H. at this coffee shop more than a handful of times to read or get work done, and I've always been impressed. With three floors (top: lots of tables and sofas, middle: Peet's coffee and lots of seating, lower: bean bags, more seat, and restrooms), you're sure to find a nice comfy place. If you need an outlet, sit at the communal tables! There is free WiFi, and even on a busy day, I didn't feel like it was slow at all.

Half off drinks if you use your Capital One debit or credit card. Score! 

Simply put, Capital One 360 Cafe is my all time favorite coffee shop to get work done. Cheers! :)
author: Christine S.

description:
Been here several times now. In fact, just yesterday, half off all Peets drink when using Cap One card, either credit or debit, score!

Free wifi, comfy, easily reached from the main artery that is Market, and easy comfortable banking accomplished too. 

No brainer.
author: Jana C.

description: Great spot! Plenty of communal tables or private tables for a meeting. Not too loud music. Good coffee too! And if you talk to the CapitalOne folks they may even give you a free coffee card
author: Raj S.

description:
The service here was great and the staff was very accommodating my needs. 

I love the fact that I can pay my bill right there straight through the ATM with no hassle.

I am committed tho this cafe every time I come to San Francisco.
author: Erika L.

description:
I wish places like this existed in Los Angeles. Was up in San Francisco for work and met a co-worker here for the day. What a great space. So many different types of seating options...from high tables, to couches, to bean bags. Everyone in there was busy focused on their own own work in front of them, which is great to be around as you try to focus on your own work. The space was very open and in a great location. 

A few negatives: The free wi-fi was a bit spotty for me so I was having to connect to my personal hot spot a number of times. The elevator only works with a key card and if you're carrying  bunch of work files like I was it was a pain to go up the stairs (tho there is a security desk at the entrance level that may have been able to get it working for me to use but I didn't ask). And got a bit hot in the afternoon sitting up in the third floor.

However I was able to sit there all day and get a bunch of work completed and all in all it is a great setup.
author: Nicole B.

description:
I love this place and use it very often when come to SF for meetings or just need to work in between. Wonderful atmosphere, Wi-Fi, outlets everywhere, casual style, super nice staff 
It feels like the place from the future, need more of these in San Jose, Palo Alto etc.  ))
author: Alex F.

description: great place to go for coffee before/after work, super close to MUNI/BART station. security guard present, ton of space to sit and work, free public restroom available too.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Synopsis: Amazing customer service.

Dets.: Three words: Evyn, Nina, and Lutie.

These ladies are amazing. From remembering my somewhat complicated coffee order (yes, I'm one of THOSE people) to asking me about my day, they go above and beyond the call to make me and other customers feel valued.

Not sure these reviews have any bearing on bonuses and raises, but maybe they should. These women are awesome, and I'll keep coming as long as they're here.

Pro tip: 
-Capital One card = 50% off beverages!
-First Wednesday of every month = free waffles (avoid if you hate crowds like I do)
author: Cami A.

description: Great three level, open space, many outlets, speedy free wifi. Couches for lounging are available. Only downside is many communal tables, limited in table space for your own. Pretty minimal noise level. This place is such a contrast from the dim lit coffee. I appreciate the lots of lighting which helps me see my work better.  I wish there is more work/study places like this around SF.
author: Carleen C.

description: Many reviews here relate to coffee. And when you get here you'll see why.  This is a place to buy a discounted drink while you get some work done.  It's not a bank.  And if you come here to solve a Capital One banking problem, the kind you can't fix online or over the phone, you are fucked.  There is one kind and helpless employee standing at a kiosk to answer simple questions like, where's the ATM?  All other questions are met with "Sorry, we can't do that here".  So in the end, the people who are reviewing this place as a cafe have it right.  Come for coffee.  Come for the atm.  Don't come to bank.
author: Art R.

description:
I love this cafe!

It is an open, modern-tech bank that meets a fused concept of a cafe lounge.

The layout is contemporary and welcoming.  You can smell the aroma of Peet's coffee and they give you a half off discount on your beverage if you use your CapitalOne debit card or credit card for the purchase.  Sweet deal!

There are plenty of seats available to do what you need to do here!  Free wi-fi!  Also, conference rooms are available upon reservations.  The bean bags on the bottom floor level, reminds me of dorm life.

This cafe is super convenient!  With CapitalOne online banking, friendly staff assistance on hand, coffee and tea to keep you running and a spacious seating area to do your work, it has everything you are looking for in a cafe that is located in central Downtown!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I'm always looking for a good cafe to work in and this became one of my favorite finds. 

It's simple here. It's easy to find, there's a Peet's which is generally good (I actually really like the Jasmine green tea), areas for doing work or lounge in, free wi-fi, and plenty of outlets. 

I think it's a solid place to sit and do work so I'll be back again sometime.
author: Sofia R.

description:
It's Peet's coffee in a better atmosphere.  I like its open space, high ceiling, various table and chair sets. You can always find one you are comfortable with. Plenty of outlets. Great space for work or just taking a rest. I wish the wifi speed could be faster though, but hey, it's free wifi! 

I will definitely come back again.
author: Kate H.

description:
Besides my office and home, I come here the most often. Central location from all the major Bart stations in downtown (Powell, Montgomery, Embarcadero), this cafe is so conveniently located. I've checked out many different cafes while living in SF but I keep coming back to this one. 

50% off all drinks if you pay with your Capital One card. Love love their gigantic space (3 floors with high ceilings) and their wifi connection has gotten stronger over the past few months (THANK YOU). I also like that they have a variety of tables and chairs with different heights-- sofas, standing tables, mid-level tables, etc. Plenty of plugs on the table too. 

They make free waffles every first Wednesday of the month. It's part of the sf.funcheap event. Never been to one, but they make fresh waffles with a machine. Line starts at 9am. Capital One hosts a few tech/design events at this cafe. 

My favorite drink is the matcha latte!
author: Christine C.

description:
Part bank, part coffee shop is a very interesting and good use of the space. There are chairs and tables available, plus Free Wi-Fi is included. Props to this part!

I decided to come here for a cup of coffee and a croissant right after coming out of the gym. Today is certainty my first time coming here. The team members at the coffee counter were very friendly. Bank staff members were also very friendly. They are located in Union Square and very easy to find.

Also, I found this facility to be very clean. With three levels here, there is a seat available somewhere. If you want to get caught up on reading and work, this is the spot. I liked how quiet it was here and not super loud either. Purchase pastry and coffee with a Capital One Debit or Credit Card. You'll get a 50% off your purchase. Bingo, that's a very nice treat! Overall, very good first experience here.

They proudly brew and serve Peet's Coffee here. If you are passing by and in need for coffee, you found the right spot.

Reasons for rating:
1. Free Wi-Fi
2. Clean facility
3. Friendly staff members
4. Three levels of seating
5. Location is easy to find
author: Bennett W.

description:
Free waffles the first Wednesday of the month! Need I say more?? They have a guy from B Street Waffles making the waffles fresh in front of you. I stopped by in December for a warm gingerbread waffle with powdered sugar on my way to work. The waffle wasn't very gingerbread-y in my opinion, but no complaints!

The cafe itself is a great place to get some work done. Free wifi, outlets and very clean, open and comfortable :)
author: Jessie L.

description: Lots of space for working and outlets everywhere.  50% discount for Capital One card holders.
author: Anthony F.

description:
I popped into Capital One 360 and had a nice chat with Bud.
I've seen Bud often when I stop into the cafe. They probably recognize me as a neighborhood regular.
We can shot the breeze about traveling in the Pacific Northwest...he's so nice.
I found out there'll be some March Madness events at the end of this week! Nice to get the skinny on what's going on at the Cafe!
author: Joanna T.

description:
half bank, half cafe. 
and half off if you use your Capital One credit card or debit card to pay for your Peet's coffee purchase.
conveniently located at Union Square.
wifi all around.
one of the great perk to be a Capital One Customer.
author: Rudy H.

description:
Definitely my favorite place to get work done in the city. Capital One Cafe is located in the heart of the Financial District - so if you work downtown it's a great place to grab a coffee.

The place has three floors and the colorful and open layout makes for a wonderful working atmosphere. The bottom floor has bean bags and restrooms. The ground floor has a Peet's coffee and some desks and lounge chairs. The upper floor is entirely a working area - with group working tables and individual tables.

Pro-tip: the Peet's inside offers 50% off if you pay with a Capital One Card.
author: Ramon Miguel F.

description: I just asked a simple question and the guy making drinks with the long hair is soooooo rude!  The guy working the register is very pleasant and helpful. Andrew is nice.
author: Angel S.

description:
Another super awesome visit to the Capital One Cafe today... Standing by my previous 5-star review!

Top ten things you can do for free (or almost free) at the @capitalone @capitalone360 #my360sf cafe:
1) Get FREE or half priced coffee drinks with any Capital One card
2) Plug in (a zillion great work spaces and every type of seating from beanbag chairs to couches to high barstools at a community table - plus free wifi)
2) Unplug! (See #2, beanbag chairs and comfy couches)
3) Paint your nails (why not? Enough room here to spread out far enough that no one else has to smell nail polish). 
4) Break dance (like I said, plenty of room)!
5) People watch. Oh SF, how you provide hours of free entertainment with this one...
6) Hail an Uber (and oh btw, use your Capital One card for a 20% rebate on Uber purchases!).
7) Use the free, and SQUEAKY CLEAN, restrooms - a rare gem in SF!!
8) Learn about Capital One cardholder only perks like concert presales and special events (currently, the iHeartRadio Jingle Ball Oct. 6-9)
9) Catch the news highlights on one of many TV's throughout the lounge, and last but not least,
10) When you're done with all the fun stuff, you can take care of any of your Capital One business right here in the cafe! Deposit to your free Orange checking account? Done. Need a free ATM? They gotcha covered. Question about quicksilver? Your query quest ends here. 
What's NOT to love about this place?? #whatsinyourwallet - if not a Capital One credit or debit card, here's 10 good reasons to change that!
author: Angela Z.

description: One of my go to cafe's for work. 3 floors of open seating areas with ample outlets and strong wifi.
author: Samantha S.

description:
"Quick and convenient" is how I would best describe this place.  At least that's how it was at 11:30 before the afternoon rush.  I only wonder how long the coffee line is during the earlier am hours.  

~ Picked up a couple of B Street Waffles.  I really really really wanted to try the maple bacon, only they didn't have any.  Booo!  I was left with choosing the lemon waffle and salted caramel waffle, $3 each.  And I gotta say, I went home, warmed them up in the microwave.  and WOW, buttery and sugary crystals!  Nice!  So good I ate both, and saved a tiny tiny piece of salted caramel for the gf to try.  j/k I gave half, but stared at her eating it, so she'd feel guilty, then she'd offer it back to me. 

~ Oh yeah, I also Checked-In on Yelp and received a free drink.  Sweet!  A large white chocolate mocha latte.  Surprisingly not too sweet, and tasted great with the waffles.  

I really like this place.  Only I was really expecting more entree type of items, but that's my fault for not checking out the menu before coming here.  This place does have plenty of tables, and I had no issues with service.  While waiting for my coffee, I took pics of the Asian art on the walls.  Jackie notice me yelping and explained the upcoming Asian Week in the city.  How cool of her!    

Other highlights:
~ A convenient atm machine next to the stairs. 
~ They also have yogurt, chips, cookies, fruit cups, parfaits, pastries, sandwiches, wraps, salads, and juice.
~ Prices between $1-3, how cool is that?

"Quick and convenient" I tell ya!
author: Ron R.

description: This place welcomes all! If you're looking for a spot to do work or just surf the web, this place is very roomy and has many outlets. Free wi-fi too! There is a small Peet's Coffee & Tea and they make sure to ask if you have a capital one card because you get 50% off every item with it! Perfect place to kill some time or do work outside your hotel!
author: Kelsey S.

description: This is a Peet's coffee shop but they have special deals for CapitalOne customers! I came here and found the latte beverages are half off! If you are their customer, make sure you take advantage of the specials!
author: Athena C.

description:
B Street Waffles..OMG!  I've had the Capital One 360 Cafe bookmarked for quite some time because I miss going to the Stonestown Farmer's Market & seeing the Belgian Waffle dude.  I stopped by yesterday on the way back to the office after 10:30.  The waffles weren't freshly made, but still quite tasty at room temperature.  The texture was chewy in the middle and still firm enough on the outside.  I got a maple bacon waffle and loved the sweet and savory combo.  It was so good.  

Prices here are cheap too.  Next time I'll have to try their coffee when I'm around.  The cafe looks cute too and is a great alternative to Starbucks.
author: Cat C.

description:
Wow with check in I got a free mocha! Score!!!!!

Aces in my book. Great space to work remotely, and the staff here is friendly.
author: Jack R.

description: Not the best experience on the banking side from one of the reps. She wasn't listening and only wanted to tell me what she wanted to tell me without listening.
author: Christopher G.

description: Excited to enjoy a creative open space in a most unlikely place!  Good wifi, good coffee, good seating, good location, good energy!
author: Wayne C.

description: One of only two available deposit atms in California and they don't have the common sense to make at least 1 ATM available afterhours or weekends?
author: Robert J.

description:
No complaints!
Needed a place to read and have a coffee and pee.
Great choice as I Yelped from my cell using a location finder
Peets coffee which is always great.  Great customer service even though I was a pain in the arse deciding what I wanted to get.

Tables single and community.  Plugs for electronics.  Free Wifi.  Bathrooms a plenty downstairs and beanbags to sleep or rest comfortably?  WHAT?

Great.  Will be back if I visit again!

I wish they had more food options but there is a 7-11 nearby and a nice pho place!
author: Mimi B.

description: Clean, calm, great place to work or just enjoy your coffee.  Coffee is half price with a capital one card!
author: Sylvain F.

description:
Who would have thought a bank could be so cool!?

The cafe is awesome for studying and being productive. It conveniently has a Peets inside, so you can get your caffeine fix and get to work. I've been here to study (read: cram) for licensure exams I take nearby at Prometric on Kearny. The first time I went, I was scared I would get hassled by the Capital One reps to open an account or something, but not once in my visits have I been approached by them. 

I like the downstairs area, because it's quiet and even has a cool seating area with bean bags. They also have downstairs meeting rooms that I think you can reserve or rent out (I saw a large group meeting in there when I was there). They have pretty clean restrooms downstairs, too - it's so nice how much they provide for customers! 

I really appreciate that a bank would consider opening something like this, where the profits may not necessarily be that high given that many people stay for a lengthy amount of time and only buy a single cup of coffee. It's so rare to find a cafe with so much space, good ambiance, outlets, restrooms, and coffee!
author: Alyssa T.

description: Great open space with anything from large tables to quieter nooks to do your work in.  Plenty of outlets and of course an ever-necessary caffeine hub on the first floor to fuel your brain :)  The best thing is that you don't have to worry about seating.  Coffee...good but your typical good coffee.
author: Mon T.

description: It appears that my apple watch transaction was hacked here yesterday and the card was then used around SF with fraudulent transactions.  So be careful and perhaps just use cash here.  Anyone else have this problem?
author: lynn s.

description:
I found this cafe by chance while walking around downtown looking for a coffee shop. The decor is modern and spacious, and very conducive to productivity! I was there around 10:30-11am and there was plenty of free space in the 3-story cafe. 

It's furnished/decorated like a wealthy, young tech company. Seriously. I've visited the SF workspaces of Meraki, Heroku, etc. and this place is resoundingly similar. 

Peet's is located on the ground level to fulfill all your coffee and pastry desires. 

Downstairs, they have a great space with tables/chairs, and a terraced-style seating arrangement by the stairs with giant beanbags! 

AND FREE WIFI. If I ever find myself having to do some work or studying around the area again, I'll definitely be back!
author: Christine L.

description:
This is literally a caffe, nothing else! They have ATMs that pretty much don't do anything! No deposits, no payments. I asked 2 guys who were there to help people with banking how to make payments or deposits and they said "that feature is definitely coming, if you want to do that now go to a Western Union"!!

I was so excited thinking this was the future of banking! Coffee and banking with a nice ambiance but no... just coffee! I'll stick to Starbucks and WF if that's the case.
author: M P.

description:
This is where I would take my clients for coffee and and discuss stuff.

They have Peet's coffee in the lobby, Capital One employees ready to answer any questions you have with your account, and 3 floors of work space. Do you need a standing desk? They have it. Table for two? They have it. Lounge chairs? Got that too. 

They have plenty of power outlets and a basement where you can conduct presentations with their double high bleacher seating with bean bag chairs. I believe you can also rent a private room for conference calls but I haven't had a chance to do that. I usually find a quite nook near...I'll let you figure that out because it's my spot! No, i will not tell you this secret quiet space!

The staff at Peet's are friendly and make your drinks quickly. I guess they have to since it's in the busy Financial District and their Capital One employees usually have something going on. The last time I was there, they were playing Mega Jenga. It sounds awesome because it is awesome.
author: John C.

description:
Upbeat, fun, half price off if you have capital one card and great energy for creative types, professionals and people that work on the road. They are centrally located on the cornet of Post Street close to Montgomery Bart station.

They have conference rooms, workspaces and fun people that work there too. I love it!
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I really like this place. I love the ambiance and it's super spacious. 

It's close to where I work and would order my coffee during my break and would usually make it on time.

The people here are super nice and my drink is always on point... lots of caffeine just the way I like it sometimes. In addition, they have a variety of delicious pastries on the go and some chocolates. 

Again, really spacious. If you have to work, this place is great to work on it whether it be from work or school. Also great to meet up with your coworkers or classmates for projects, etc

I usually order their white chocolate mocha and it is yummy!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Awesome place to hang out and study/ do work for a few hours. It's central location is great for a few hour break. Love the matcha honey latte from Peets. Use your capital one card for half off coffee - a great perk!
author: Ranita G.

description:
This cafe is awesome. Capital One 360 (formerly ING) is like the hip sister of Capital One. There are two ATMs inside and some nice sales reps, but other than that, it's pretty far from your normal bank environment. The rest of the space is full of comfortable tables and chairs/sofas and free WIFI. There are three floors of workspace to utilize. Also, the sales reps are there to talk if you want to, but they won't bother you to open accounts or anything.

Plus, there are so many free perks! There's a Peet's Coffee inside, and they give 50% off drinks when you purchase with a Capital One credit card or debit card. They also do random freebies- be sure you subscribe to their facebook page for updates. For Lunar New Year, they did free lunch from the Chairman Truck (one of my favorites!). I've also gotten a few free drink coupons from some of the sales reps.
author: Alice T.

description:
Huge fan of this place! 

I haven't actually stayed in the cafe and have only have ordered drinks to-go. Each time, the service has been amazing. I think there was only one time that I had to wait more than 5 minutes for my drink. It was a very busy day so I'm not complaining. 

The staff is very efficient at getting your drinks out on a timely fashion. Especially during the morning rush. 

The cafe is always clean and I love how spacious this place is. 

If you're a Cap One card holder, you get 50% off your drink order! Unfortunately, I am not. :(
author: Tiffany N.

description: I've been a loyal customers for years. I really like this place and as a someone that works in the tech industry, this has become one of my constants in a crazy world :) really nice employees from bankers to baristas!
author: Thanh P.

description:
Spacious cafe, modern work spaces with ample room for impromptu meetings, free WiFi, and Peet's coffee. What's there not to like? I think you can rent out their downstairs meeting rooms too.

While the cafe is staffed by Capital One reps who may inquire if you're interested in opening accounts, I've never found any of them to be pushy and they're really friendly. My first experience was during a Yelp Elite event where they had a pretty sweet sign up bonus. 

For those financially minded, if you open up a 360 checking account and use the debit card for Peet's coffee purchases, you get 50% off each time.

I just wish they opened a bit later so people could come by after the standard business hours.
author: Steven C.

description:
I still for the life of me have not figured out this business model: You probably pay 60-80k (probably more) per month for rent and you charge 2 bucks for a great cup of coffee...free wifi too.  

None the less this place is amazing...a great place to meet up and discuss biz over a cup. Chill and watch Cnn on the big screens. Bring a laptop and surf the web...tis all good.

Place is no longer top secret and gets pretty busy but thats life in the big city.
author: David G.

description:
Central location to get work done while sipping a cup of coffee. It's an interesting approach to Wi-Fi at a Coffee Shop: more like a small meeting/work space/Capital One bank that HAPPENS to have a Peet's Coffee inside, and SUPER-conveniently located. ;)

Only taking a star off because the Wi-Fi (at least in the basement level) is fairly slow.
author: Manny H.

description: I mostly like to go here because I get 50% off. When I make an actual choice on coffee, Peet's is a pretty solid one because their beans don't seem to be extra extra bold, and earthy like Starbucks or other places. Plus, I'm a real sucker for an almond milk latte. I do have to say, that there seems to be a lot of space for those that work or need to go, get comfy, and take care of business. I could see myself going there to style or hangout for a few hours if I lived in SF.
author: Sierra R.

description:
I had to make a large check deposit. I could not scan it via the mobile app, nor upload a scan on the website. My options were to drive to the city and go to the 360 Cafe, or mail the check to Capital One 360. Given the amount of the check, I decided to do the former as it would be faster to drive to the city and deposit the check, rather than to mail it and wait.

I called C1360's support folks, made sure that this is the only bank that accepts check deposits in SFBA. They reassured me that this was so. Next, I inquired if I can make the deposit over the weekend. They said, yes, the lobby is open and you can access the ATM without a problem. Before heading out, I called one more time and made sure that there won't be anything limiting my access to the ATM and successful deposit. The rep said that I was good to go. 

I went up to the city, battled crazy traffic on the highway (thanks congestion!), then even crazier traffic around Union Square (thanks holiday shoppers and construction!!) only to find out that, no you cannot access the lobby on the weekend. Both doors were locked. There was no sign to buzz in, or scan your card to get in. Nothing. Sorry bud, you are SOL.

Given this terrible experience, I'm going to have to cancel my account. Two wasted hours plus traffic hell are not worth it. It has been nice banking with you C1306/ING Direct. I've been a loyal member since 2008. 

PS: Remember 3.0% APY. Those were the good times. 
PPS: San Mateo Credit Union is pretty dope.
author: Zlatko U.

description:
My co-worker recommended to come here whenever I need a little breather from the office. I really like how spacious the cafe, it has three floors and the bottom floor is more of the quiet room. There is a Peet's Coffee inside which is great when you need that extra caffeine kick. Also there is free WiFi, definitely keeps you productive :) 

I would definitely come here again, it's a great little escape!
author: Natalie L.

description:
50% off Peet's coffee if you use your capital one card!

I love coffee and I love discounts. Put them together and I have just found my second home. Plenty of seating and outlets and the bankers/baristas don't give you a guilt trip if you don't sign up for an account. You also don't get dirty looks when you bring in your own food or not purchase anything (I have seen others do this). Only gripe is that it has the standard business hours M-F 7am-6pm....which means I can't get discounted coffee over the weekend!
author: Michelle C.

description: 5 stars as a work cafe.  Spacious, clean, with lots of tables and outlets. Coffee and snacks are good.
author: JJ M.

description: Place is a good spot for catching up on work, start-up style! I wish the internet was a little bit faster, and the food was a little fresher.
author: Kerry G.

description:
As others have pointed out, this place is awesome. Stopped on by one day to catch up with a friend and get some work done in the afternoon. Was going to buy a pb cookie and tea, when the friendly person behind the counter highly recommended I try this one slightly cheaper mini cupcake instead (which they only have on Thursdays I'm told) instead of the pb cookie. I'm gonna spoil the surprise for you - this sucker was like eating a moist Reese's Pieces, as it has a dollop of a denser peanut butter cake in the center of a chocolate cake with frosting and nuts on top. Hooray for successfully down-selling a customer, almost like spotting a unicorn! I'm going to have to try more of the creations of the company that supplies this place with baked goodies.

Fear not, weary office-less traveler, there were plenty of other laptop-wielding road warriors busy staring at screens scattered throughout the 3 floors of space (one is below ground, which also happens to be where the washroom and a conference room is). I love the bright open atmosphere, with the ample and varied seating arrangements, plenty of outlets, and free wifi. The wifi is also my only quibble, as it disconnects you every 30-60 min it seems, forcing you to re-login periodically. But that is a small annoyance to pay for a cafe that actually seems to welcome people working in it; It's not like I'm just crashing on one of their beanbags streaming netflix all day.

The cafe must be a bit of a loss leader for ING, what with it being so huge and in Union Square. Who knows how long it will be around, but take advantage of it while you can!
author: Linus W.

description:
What a neat spot in downtown SF! It's a bank and a coffee shop with the vibe of a Bay Area startup! Step indoors and you'll notice the open space, colorful interior, and the busy but quick moving line at Peet's coffee. 

Get your Capital one banking done on the main floor, grab a seat on one of the red couches downstairs, or opt for a table upstairs to get some work done. Free wifi + 50% off at Pete's Coffee with your Capital One card. It's definitely on my list of go-to cafe spots in the area!
author: Ruby C.

description:
91 cents for a cup of ice tea. What's not to like?! You get some drink bargains with the 50% off w/ Capital One card deal. Good strategy on Capital One's part to get people to sign up for accounts. 

But I'll tell you what's not to like (for real)- during weekday afternoons this place is packed and it's hard to find seating. My friend and I had a hard time finding 2 spots by each other.

Lots of people come here and don't even get drinks- just use that free wifi, homie. Decor is sterile- very bank-like. Even though I prefer more intimate coffee shops, this is a place to actually work and get stuff done. With their 50% deal, I'll be sure to come back.
author: Joanna L.

description:
I deducted 1 star because the blended freddo really isn't good - don't get that, just grab a tea or something. 

Apart from that, I love this space! 3 floors of seating with a relatively open layout, free wifi, non-pestering staff and walls of windows? Awesome! This space is just the right amount of loud to keep you focused on your work but not feel like you're in a library or small cafe, akin to a coworking space. There are also plenty of outlets, which I'm thankful for.
author: Morgen B.

description:
I am so grateful for this place! I need a spot to work outside of my house once a week, and Capital One 360 Café is the best I've found. I feel uncomfortable squatting for long periods at many smaller cafes, where the manager is (rightfully) hoping to turn tables--there is only so much coffee I can drink. But this café is inviting for people who need to get serious work done for several hours; it's huge, welcoming, and I don't feel like I'm taking up too much space.

Things I like:
- Three levels of seating, and it's all attractive, airy, and open. There are couches, tables for groups, high tops, little nooks, and places to sprawl. 
- Outlets EVERYWHERE.
- Free WiFi
- Clean bathrooms
- Reasonably priced coffee, treats, and salads--even a vegan one!
- Friendly employees
- Top 40 Music. Taylor Swift, "Temperature" by Sean Paul--yes, yes, bring it on! I'm tired of the hipster music on rotation at every other café.

One thing I'm very curious about is the P&L for this venture. They surely can't be raking in enough money from the food and new Capital One accounts to justify the crazy-expensive real estate costs?!

I hope to see more spaces designed for people who need a good spot to work. I have tried Workshop Café, purpose-built for that scenario, but like Capital One Café even better.
author: Elinor A.

description: Free wifi, banking without the fuss and half off coffee! Not sure what else you could possibly ask for. Modern banking that allows you to do transactions much more efficiently than traditional branches. Open, bright interior with free wifi and lots of seating makes it an ideal work space!
author: Mary S.

description:
Disclaimer: I've been an ING customer for a long time. So I like this online bank. In case u didn't know they have the best interest rates for savings and checking accounts, and free ATM access. Not sure if anything will change now that Capital One acquired them this year.

Normally everything is handled online, no branches, no tellers. But just like Apple has their own stores, ING decided that having a physical presence would help connect with the community. This new bank-cafe-internet hybrid is one of only 8 locations in the country. http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WMeAZw2JYfBfoo2BbBPy5w/l.jpg The iPads serve as self service teller machines.

The food counter inside sells Peet's coffee, soups, pre-packaged sandwiches (made by Eat Curbside truck) and some vegan pastries. http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9jVIkguXowh_03JxoEVDYg/l.jpg

The 1st and 2nd floors space is filled with tables and comfy seats, http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/YY85aA4JAipG5zyEw56iWQ/l.jpg with FREE wifii, similar to a Starbucks. And downstairs has FREE meeting space with AV equipment that u can reserve for groups of up to 40-50 people. http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/X069PTd6js-oW1aLPhkvZw/l.jpg

** Update: In 2013, name was revised to Capital One 360 Cafe.
author: Luis C.

description:
They have outlets, wifi, and relatively clean bathrooms. I've worked in the space for up to 5 hours and no one blinked. 

Love that they serve something other than Starbucks. You can also bring in your own food and they don't hassle you.

The security guards can be real jerks to teens and anyone looking homeless...which emotionally makes me happy so that my new work utopia remains in good shape but morally I'm a little conflicted.

5 stars!!
author: Mechelle L.

description:
Regarding their banking customer service, each of my visits here the staff went above and beyond the industry standards and my expectations to achieve my objectives, which, in some instances, I honestly didn't think were possible. Furthermore, every encounter I've had here, regardless of my situation (i.e. showing up right at the last-minute before closing needing to make a quick ATM cash deposit), I have had the best possible (sometimes impossible) outcome that was entirely dependent upon the courtesy, discretion and diligence of the Capital One 360 staff.

While seemingly redundant to mention the several amenities here (see other reviews), it'd also dilute the my rest of my perhaps understated review, especially when I consider my customer service experiences at other banking institutions. Succinctly put,- the staff here are SOLID...and although I've worked with many different staff members here on various occasions, all of whom I'd recommend, Jane is my favorite as she is the enchantress who magically precipitated my presumably impossible desideratum.

That said, I hope you, the reader, will have as delightful and satisfying experience here as I've had and am confident will continue to have. (fingers-crossed anyway)
author: Jason K.

description:
So. Yes. Love this spot. 
It's a bank and a cafe. You don't have to be the customer of the bank in order to hang out here. But then, being a customer is not a bad deal because with the card, you can get 50% off drinks at the cafe. 

My favorite spot to work, doodling, hang out, or daydreaming. 

I would say I prefer this spot than Workshop Cafe just because you can hang around here without having to pay $2/hour. However, if you want a more dedicated internet connection, you may want to go to Workshop Cafe instead. Otherwise, this spot is perfect!
author: Haryati S.

description:
Great  for the professional on the go. 
Nice space to work in groups or on your own at your laptop. Also great if you are a Capital One customer you get a discount an all Peet's Coffee.
author: Celestina D.

description: Great central location! Coffee isn't that strong, but customer service is superb
author: Olatayo A.

description:
I discovered this place because of weekly Toastmasters meetings that are held in the conference rooms downstairs. This cafe has a great vibe with plenty of seating and electrical outlets on all three floors. They even have a Peet's! Everyone who works for Capital One and approaches all the Peet's customers is super friendly, whether or not you are interested in opening up an account. Sometimes they will get you free drinks and trinkets from Peet's. It's a very warm and welcoming environment. 

The whole space, including the conference rooms, is clean and comfortable. Oh and I almost forgot about the fast and free WiFi. Great place to spend a productive afternoon!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Is your new year's resolution to spend less money? Is it to have more energy to work more productively or be friendlier with officemates? THIS PLACE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN.

The drinks are already cheap. $1.50 for coffee, iced or hot. $2 americanos, iced or hot. $3 lattes. They brew Peet's, which ain't the fanciest or most hipster, but it's local and it isn't that terribly bitter stuff from Starbucks.

*Infomercial voice*

Here's where it gets better - if you open an account with them, you get HALF OFF all drinks! Catch them during a cool promo, and the deal gets even sweeter! I opened an account around Labor Day and got $150 FOR FREE just by using my debit card three times. (I obviously used it for half off espresso drinks at this cafe.) At $1 for an iced americano and $150 just for opening this account, I basically get 150 americanos FOR FREE. 

*Even more enthusiastic infomercial voice*

BUT WAIT THAT'S NOT ALL! 

Follow them on twitter for weekly giveaways! They have Trivia Thursdays and if you know the answer your drink is on them! Or sometimes you'll just have to engage with them for a free drink, like telling them your new year's resolution, or bringing in a canned food for charity. Sometimes they'll even give out free lunch! You just have to know when to go. On the first Wednesday of every month, a nice man from b street waffles gives out fresh, warm, liege waffles FOR FREE! 

But hurry, this offer won't last long. Try them today! (Just kidding.)
author: Jenn C.

description:
Once you get past all the weird juxtapositions of this space, the marriage of bank and working cafe is actually kind of genius. 

Starting up a company and don't want to rent out space with WeWork or pay for time at The Workshop? You could totally mooch off the free (albeit sluggish) wifi and take a few meetings in the conference rooms downstairs. After you've decided that you need capital to help that business scale, you could walk two steps to any Capital One rep; they've been standing there all day and are eager for attention! 

Studying for an upcoming exam? The caffeine (Peet's) does its job and there are plenty of semi-private nooks if you don't want to hobnob with the aforementioned entrepreneurs. There are even beanbag chairs that evoke the feel of a dorm lounge/common room.

Need a neutral place to have a work meeting, but can't stand the office? I've had plenty of conversations over coffee at a two-top. Better yet, this place is super accessible via public transportation, so there's really no excuse for not being able to rendezvous here. The greyish carpet is of a generic corporate weave and makes everybody feel like they're still on the office treadmill.

Somewhat soulless? Yes. But also practical, productive, and perfect. San Francisco, meet your new favorite corporate Stepford cafe.
author: Sherry W.

description:
Completely stumbled upon this place one day. So random! I was so confused. Was it a bank? was it a cafe? I could not tell for the life of me! After a few minutes of digesting the situation, and what it was, it turned out it was one of the best coffee shops/cafes that I've come across ever! The prices were such a steal!!! $2 for a LARGE cup of coffee. Even if it was a LATTE. What! it was only $2 for pastries too, ANY KIND. 

There were so many work spaces available: tables, chairs and outlets! Wow! I hope this place stays and more spring up throughout the city an d in other areas.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
OK, I know that there is a disappearing line between phones, television, and computers.

But 360 Café is a coffee shop/bank.  

The prices are very easy on your wallet.  Coffee is free with a Yelp check in. The coffee and service are very good. (Don't miss the shortbread.  About 30 minutes after I bought it, the barista announced that all pastry is half-price after 5:00 pm.)   Wifi is fast.

This "coffee shop" is three floors of free work space, talking space, meeting rooms, and places to hang out.

And -- I am not making this up -- the barista can tell you all about banking services.  I'm still scratching my head but I liked it.
author: Charles S.

description:
It's actually a front for an online bank - but you can come in and have coffee (good coffee!!) too.  I came in for the coffee and opened a savings account for free coffee and higher interest on my savings than my credit union.  That was a year ago.  I thought it was "just another bank".  Since then, I've moved  my bill pay, direct deposits and checking.  They have competitive interest rates for savings and checking - and they have amazing customer service and the best online banking website that I have found!  I could not believe the phone experience when I called for help setting up a link to another bank.  The person on the line was intelligent, alert, cheerful and very helpful.  She sounded like those headhunters on the phone - you know, friendly, making that personal connection and drilling for information - only the Capital One help was only interested in helping me.  As she said when she answered the call: "How can I help you to save money?"  I love this bank.  I love their best ever website.  I love my Capital One credit card.  I love the Capital One 360 Cafe with the good coffee, fast and free WiFi.  I love all the friendly Capital One people scooting about to make sure I'm happy - especially the one who went in the back room to find a connector so I could charge my phone.

Oh... stock ticker: COF  http://www.nasdaq.com/symbol/cof/interactive-chart?timeframe=1y
author: Steve S.

description:
I love this cafe.  Since I've started working my new job, M-F, I'm pretty much somewhere in the city with free wifi.  Mainly here, few selected starbucks, and a restaurant or two (girl gotta eat something sustainable sometime + i would feel embarrassed going here M-F hogging the outlets). 

Bathrooms on the basement floor (which has a cool set up, colorful and fun if you just want to potato couch out).  1st/2nd floor = plenty of sittings and tons of outlets. 

I bank with capital one 360 because I was swept in, but little has changed.  Which is awesome. I mean, I have the account because I don't want to think about my savings.  Just put the money in, set it and forget it.  I don't want to have easy access so I've yet to use or even look at the ATMs here.  

Also TV ads that intro the baristas is a nice touch.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
The 4.5-5 star average for this location lives up to its rating! Not only because of the welcoming ambiance, but more importantly, the way they treat their guests with superior customer service.

Having a Capital One 360 account can be a struggle sometimes, especially when depositing checks or withdrawing cash. I had to come to this location to deposit a check that was over the mobile deposit limit, and so it was my first time here.

I was greeted by Mason, who showed to have exemplary service while at the same time seeming like he loves and enjoys his job! He is the definition of outstanding customer service, and Capital One truly is lucky to have him as an employee of 5 years now.

I needed help getting through into my account and he made the whole proccess quick, easy, and engaging! I felt compelled to leave a review because he gave me world class service with a smile!
author: John H.

description:
From time to time I get .75 coffee here because I have a capital 360 card (and I suppose I can use the check in deal too), and sometimes even free coffee when they post on their twitter account. However, their coffee, although in a bigger cup than a Starbucks tall, is sour to me. the cafe is out of the way on my walk from BART to work, so I don't really stop by, especially since I don't find the coffee worth it.

Follow them on twitter, though. From time to time they give out free food such as waffles for breakfast and food truck food at lunch.  (To those who already follow them, sorry to divulge the secret) :X
author: Annie A.

description:
A cafe that doubles as a place where you can do your capital one banking. 
This cafe is encapsulated with large windows so there's lots of natural light and also you can people watch!

Aside from the main floor where there's high tables where you can sit at or even work on it as a standing desk, there's also a floor downstairs with more chairs and tables + bean bags! If those floors are full, they also have an upstairs that has lots of tables and outlets

The Wi-Fi can be a little slow in busy hours and it might take awhile to connect to (minor gripe).

Everyone working here is always courteous and friendly to greet you. Sometimes they have deals for free coffee and such! 

Other than that, you have your usual Peet's coffee and tea selections, great place to work during the day. They do close at 6 tho!
author: Sean S.

description:
This is my go-to meeting spot in SF. It's really close to BART, it has a beautifully modern design, and there's a ton of open space.

There are three floors, each with plenty of tables and couches. If I'm ever in the area and I need a place to sit down and get some work down, I'll definitely make a stop here. They have free wifi and Peet's coffee, perfect for spending an entire afternoon here.
author: Richie Z.

description:
Nice place to have a cup of coffee and have client discussion or a chat with friends 

THese guys even have plenty of place to have presentations and seating arrangements(chair and bean bags).
The staff are friends and ready to help you in each and every possible way.I am using this service quite sometime 
and very happy with these guys service.
author: Raja Y.

description:
What an amazing and completely unexpected cafe in the Financial District! 

I came here for the first time recently for a business meeting, and the setting couldn't have been better. Large, bright, clean, modern space with lots of tables spread out over 3 floors. There are plenty of places to work or sit and chat, and the free wifi worked great.

I got a large cup of really great tasting coffee for a mere $1.50, and a cup of vegan carrot-tomato soup for only $2. The soup was absolutely delicious, and I was super impressed with the employees knowledge of their products and attention to detail. 

A variety of milks were readily available at the fixins station - didn't even have to ask for soy! 

You're obviously doing something right, Capital One. Share the love with the Peninsula and set up shop in  Palo Alto or Mountain View! I promise I'll be your most loyal patron. Pretty please?
author: Rebecca S.

description:
The good: spacious, free wi-fi, different set-ups (tables, benches, chairs, bean bags, high stools etc.)

The bad: crowded, Peet's coffee, people who set up their entire laptop, mouse, monitor, keyboard, notepad, charging station, plate of food, drink and bags to take up space.

At least they don't have a Starbucks, but please get some better coffee i.e. Stumptown!
author: E E.

description:
It's a great atmosphere for getting work done, and there are a bunch of tables spread out throughout the 3 floors, so I can talk to my friends without feeling like I'm being disruptive to anyone next to me.

Most importantly, there's a mystical power in this place that gets me to be productive. That's worth all the stars.
author: Teresa P.

description:
Oh god I love this place. I wish this place is open on weekends too.

Pro:
- Plenty of space
- Shitload of outlets
- Relatively stable wifi
- Convenient location
- Friendly staff
- Clean restroom

Con:
- Closes early, and open only during weekdays
author: Sun K.

description:
I wanted to take the time to write an update since Gabriel from this branch took the time to personally reply to my review and put her team on the task of figuring out what was going on with my car loan.

While ultimately I did end up just paying my loan off early since HQ was so difficult to work with, the outreach Gabriel's team did helped me get things finalized more quickly, and the poor experience I had with HQ is not a reflection of her or her team.

Thanks for your help! It was greatly appreciated.
author: Sophie B.

description:
This is probably the best cafe to study at in the Financial District of San Francisco for these 10 reasons:

1) Very spacious
2) Clean (even the bathrooms)
3) Cheap drinks
4) Well-lit
5) Relatively quiet
6) Good for people watching
7) Lots of plugs available on long tables
8) 3 floors of places to study/work
9) Conveniently located near lots of eateries (fidi and union square)
10) Sometimes employees come around with a survey on an iPad and if completed you get a free drink ticket

I doubt I'll ever open a Capital One account, but I very much appreciate their cafe establishment. However, maybe subconsciously I'll put on a suit advise someone to open an account with them.

Bottom line, ideal place to get some work done in a central area of a busy SF district. A BART station is close by so if you're from another part of the bay, you can make a nice study day in the city utilizing Capital One 360 Cafe.
author: Marlon T.

description: Love the open airy feel.  So many places and ways to relax.  Their coffee is good and fresh.  Very easy to get to.  What an awesome idea.
author: Jerrie J.

description:
Is it just me or does the internet take forever to connect to?! It took a good 5 minutes to get on the login page. Now it just took another 2 minutes to connect after I've entered the pw. This is my third attempt. First attempt, the log-in page would not show up (I use a Macbook), so I had to go in settings to "forget" this network, then I finally got to the page to enter in the pw. Connected and worked fine for 15 minutes but now it disconnected again.

I just used my phone tethering for the last 30 mins because it was so unstable (you can tell too because the music in the cafe pauses and then starts again, as if it's buffering on a weak connection). Finally connected back to the internet now.

B street waffles ($3) is really good. Their americano ($2) is not bad. The music is too loud for me, it's really hard to concentrate especially when the music is choppy. Guys at the counter are nice though.
author: Maggie G.

description:
Amazing space! Big, airy, and clean. Hopefully it stays like this after more people know about this place. I think it would be better if they have more seatings in the 1st floor. Seems that there are a lot of wasted space.

I didn't check out the 2nd floor, but it looks super comfy with a ton of bean bags to sit on.

Their sandwiches/salads are from Eat curbside. The sandwich was just ok because it's cold, but I'll try their salad next time...
author: Novalina N.

description:
I wish I knew about this place sooner. 
Lotta outlets, lotta space, lotta wi-fi. 
Feels more like working at a startup then a cafe. 
Best part is Waffle Wednesdays when B. Street Waffles give out freshly made liege waffles.
author: Augusto M.

description:
Buy a drink and settle in! They offer free coworking space with free wifi! There's lots of different seating options from tall counters, to traditional table and chairs, to the modern giant steps with big cushions to lounge. There's ample outlets too.

The staff are incredibly friendly and make you feel very welcome! The drinks are very reasonably priced, and dare I say, downright cheap even? 

I really enjoyed working here with my coworkers one afternoon. The space is very large and there's three floors. It's well lit and has a very inviting atmosphere.

We were there on a Friday evening until closing, and they even offered some of the prepared food to customers to take home for free as they were leaving! This really left a lasting impression with me! This really goes above and beyond in customer service. 

Also, every first Wednesday of the month, enjoy a free b.street Waffle at the cafe! It's offered in the morning. They offer a new unique flavor every month like Maple Bacon! 

I will definitely be back.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Great place to get some work done or just get out of the sun and give your feet a break from walking. It seems like just a bank from the outside but actually has a Peet's coffee inside with plenty of couches and tables to sit at. FREE wifi is always a plus and they were giving away free Chapstick and sunscreen as well. Not too shabby.
author: Jenny B.

description: Slightly odd place for this review - which is really for the 360 Checking account. This was GREAT for me traveling on ATM fees and when I had some major, major, drama... they fixed it FAST. Thanks. Want to show appreciation somewhere so might as well be here.
author: John G.

description:
a star for the throwback and playing old school backstreet boys!
a star for being one of the only cap one atms around sf
a star for 50% off peets coffee and drinks when using a capone debt or cc card
a star for the spacious layout/ lounges/ and free wifi
and another for being an awesome bank! 

wish they had more atms and branches around sf but hopefully that will be soon
author: Brenda L.

description:
This place is awesome. Very spacious, lots of outlets, places to lounge, lay out, munch and drink or work on a laptop.
