The bathroom stalls are very roomy and well maintained. I'm kind of surprised, pleasantly. This is a good spot to catch up on work emails or plan out your San Francisco trip!
author: Maya T.

description:
This is basically a coffee shop + co-working space + bank all rolled up into one awesomely convenient package. The friendly baristas will take your order and make you tea or coffee, as baristas typically do. But they are also legit bankers that will help you with whatever questions you have with your Capital One 360 checking or savings accounts. Kind of confusing and mind-blowing at the same time. Plus, they give you their already cheap drinks for half off if you use their card to purchase. As if the discounts weren't enough, the barista banker guy still gave me a bunch of free drink cards during one of my first visits that I still continue to use now. SCORE. 

There are three stories with plenty of comfortable and diverse seating that range from shared work tables to private meeting rooms to bean bag chairs. The atmosphere is really conducive to productivity as everybody here looks fairly professional(ish) and acts like they are all working on something extremely important, which makes me want to also do the same. So here I am...working on this very important Yelp review.
author: Michaela T.

description:
What can beat half price coffee when you use your 360 card?  An ice latte for $1.82! This place is very spacious and the people working here are very friendly.  They have a lot of places - tables, couches and bean bag chairs to sit back and relax or get some work done with their free wifi.
They went through a remodel about two weeks ago and changed from just serving Peets coffee to actually having Peets baristas making the coffee.  They're still working something's out as I think many of the baristas are new, so give them a few weeks if you are in a rush for your caffeine fix.  I also did prefer the food offered before the change - more variety of food choices and more reasonable prices, rather than the Peets food.  I often just pick up some food from somewhere else before.
author: Christina C.

description: Great online bank offering ATMs with awesome LIVE customer service, specifically Pat. Come see him if your need help! Plus discounted Peet's... so happy.
author: YK P.

description:
Spacious, with a hip and lively feel
It's a cafe, but more than that, here's the deal
They're owned by Capital One
So in terms of marketing..actually, there's not a ton
But they do have some people trying to engage but at least they don't call you "hon". 

I like the cafe. The coffee is eh, the salad was actually decent and the fact that they have so much space is great.  I really like the vibe as it's different but you can get work done here.
author: Dennis K.

description: Large comfy sitting area ranging from large tables to isolated bean bags. Clean bathrooms and a great cup of joe. Spread over three floors,  great spot to meet or just kill time. I would recommend this spot instead of the other hundreds of coffee shops around the area.
author: John L.

description: Coffee +free wifi+ power outlets+ Bank + comfy seats+ plenty of cozy space+ restroom. What else is there to say?Perfect place for me while waiting for the wife at the french consulate.
author: Gerick Y.

description: Great innovative benefit for those of us who have a Capital One account. Best little secret!
author: Daniel R.

description:
Essentially repeating the words of some of my peers that have already reviewed, but the Capital One 360 Cafe is definitely a great spot to go to recharge on some coffee and snacks (and recharge your laptops and phones too), check out some e-mails, and even have a nice meeting with some people. Located on a very convenient area as well, it becomes a great pit stop for any shopping day!

It's definitely an interesting concept that a bank is also hosting a cafe, and also includes a nice incentive to own one of their products. If you check out at the register with a capital one card, your entire order is 50% off! Stop by whenever you get a chance, it's at least worth a drink and a nice break!
author: Andy H.

description:
This place is awesome if you want to spend a day computing. When I first moved to the city I was staying in a hostel while I looked for a place to live. I came here everyday and used it as my base of operations for apartment hunting.

This place is huge! Three floors all together. There's lots of space, lots of seating, lots of plugs, etc. It's a great space. Plus, on the top floor there is a corner just covered in these giant bean bags. It's my favorite nook. Come in, take my boots off, spread out and such; yeah it's as comfy as it gets for coffee shops.

The staff is nice too; not your typical pretentious too cool for school types you normally get from many coffee shops. Though heads up, when you order they may encourage you to open an ING account~shocking! In fact the staff is so easy going here that they don't get upset if you come everyday, all day, use their internet, bring your own food, not buy anything, etc. They do a wonderful job of being welcoming and harboring a good working environment. Lots of people use this as a free office.

I haven't done a connection speed test there, but it's certainly faster than most coffee shops in the city (where less than 1Mb/s up and down is all too common). WiFi needs a password so just ask someone at the counter.

Drinks are cheap too.
author: Vivian A.

description: This is definitely the place where you want to go to study or work for a while. It's quiet, clean and big place to stay.
author: Lana H.

description:
The coffee is so cheap and awesome. Not to mention, there's tons of workspace and outlets so you don't have to worry about being cramped! If you wanted to, you could even hog a entire table to yourself. No big deal. (But don't, that's rude.)

Random little warning though, the basement is sort of stuffy. The air down there feels super gross and muggy.
author: Joey Y.

description:
the BEST place to get work done in the city that's not a library!  kind of reminds me of the google office.

there are a lot of tables / outlets, and everyone is doing work.  unlike most places in san francisco, ing direct cafe has high ceilings and lots of space!  it's relatively quiet compared to other cafes simply because it's not the kind of place where people come to chat with their friends.

ing direct cafe serves peets coffee, which isn't exactly blue bottle, but at least it gets the job done.  coffee is pretty cheap, and i think you get a discount if you have a ing direct card or something, but now that capital one has acquired ing, i'm not sure how it works!

since the baristas are pretty well versed in banking, it's a good place to get some light advice.  the only downside to this is that answering questions = holding up the line.  i waited longer in line when ordering my latte, than waiting for the latte itself.

you can reserve space online BTW!  so if you have a project to get done and don't have access to a room at work, it's perf.  

i only wish that it was open on weekends, or past 6 pm.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is such a weird bank/cafe/marketing ploy, but when I worked in FiDi I found myself here quite often so I guess it's effective. There is a lot of cushy seating room which is good for casual business meetups. Again, the setup confuses me, as my encounter with a super friendly cashier further muddied the question of whether the baristas work for the bank, or the cafe: As I hand over a simple cup of OJ to pay, he says, "Orange juice for $2. That's a great price. Well that's what we do here--save money!" with a flashy smile. Nice dude, but it's amusing how the whole place seems to be caught in an eternal identity crisis. You may go in for a latte, but come out with a new bank account?
author: Amy G.

description: The cafe is okay, their offerings aren't any different than Starbucks. Free wifi is great, but very slow which defeats the purpose of working on your laptop and paying to drink coffee and eat pastries. I can do that at Starbucks w/faster wifi.
author: M J.

description: Pat was incredibly helpful! I've been a customer for 3 years through their online portal and it was my first time coming here. I have to say that my experience was super seamless--and he even hooked it up with free peets coffee! Thank you for disrupting the brick and mortar banking space :)
author: Nicu L.

description:
We all know that moving to a new city is not the easiest thing. You barely know your way around, you have to move all your stuff to a new place and you have no idea which are the cool spots in the city to unwind.

Well let me tell you, finding this cafe made my move SO MUCH BETTER! (not trying to be cheesy, but it was great!)

Walking in I immediately felt the energetic young office vibe - just what I need as a recent college graduate seeking to relocate! Then walking up to the counter and realizing the coffee is not overpriced... neither is the food... and it actually tastes great?! At that point you have to stop and think - is it too good to be true?

Finally, the last requirements: 
- Plugs? So many and everywhere
- Tables? Always space available even though it's crowded
- Wifi? FAST!!!

I'm sold. Welcome to my new "home" office.
author: Anna G.

description:
I'm moving away from the Bay this weekend, so I feel the need to write a farewell ode to ING Direct Cafe.

I went back for a nostalgia visit this past week and I got exactly what I was looking for. The smells and sounds brought me back to the furious summer days of bar study, where this cafe saved me from insanity.

Lattes are still spot-on good.  Even the GF found it palatable (and she usually doesn't like coffee).

I'll miss you. Stay awesome!

Great bank, too ;)
author: Eddy P.

description: It's an interesting combination of a bank and coffee shop. You can also use their free WiFi to work, they have plenty of seating and tables with outlets to charge your laptop. I have not tried their coffee, but I would not try the new javivas they're too sugary to my taste buds.
author: Sarah G.

description: Wow this place is super friendly and a good concept . There is Peets coffee and credit cards go figure. Also checking accounts and more.
author: P C.

description:
Hmmmm... what a curious spot!  I thought it was a giant bank but as I walked by, I saw there was a coffee bar.  The hubs needed an afternoon drip so in we went.  So...it is a bank and a coffee bar and a hang out spot.  I ended up talking to Steph who wears several hats.  Besides serving up great coffee, she is also a banker and heads up the social media for this location.  The space has a lot of room to spread out and work (the wifi might be free, I didn't check).  The coffee bar is cool and then there are iPads around with bankers who can help you set up and manage an ING account.  
I liked the whole concept and Steph was great.  They obviuosly have a cool community thing going on in the company and I can appreciate that.
author: Cassie P.

description:
First of all, this place rocks!  I love the big open space, and how innovative ING bank is with a work-space-cafe like this.  Forget the $2.50 Peet's cup, and go here with your ING card for $0.75 cup and better working space.  Read on for details.  

This isn't really a legit cafe or coffee shop.  It's a bank.  What does this mean?  

What makes it great (because it's a bank):
- Awesome three-floored (including basement) working space, complete with conference rooms you can reserve and use for FREE.
- Friendly and very professional staff.
- Bargain Peet's coffee.  Great discounts if you use ING (details below)

Not so great (because it's a bank):
- Limited selection of food.
- Food will be generic, since the 'kitchen' is also very limited to basic counter-top.
- Not the same variety of coffee, latte, cappuccino, and all the embellishments that you may be used to.
- No ma & pa intimate cafe feel.  It has a corporate feel.

Details on deals:
- Ask barista about how to use conference rooms. It's free.
- Brews Peet's. One medium size cup $1.50. Use your ING card and it's half.
- Sign up for automatic transfers on site, and get 5 free drinks card - for any drinks.
author: David K.

description:
During our trip to San Francisco, my husband and I scoured the area near our hotel for some good coffee shops that was NOT a Starbucks chain (we wanted to try something different). Alas we came across this place. What an interesting idea: combining both coffee and a financial corporation into it's very own coffee shop! Offering current and potential clients a "shot of savings" in their latte and also proudly serving Peets coffee (which we learned has a strong presence in San Francisco), we knew we had to check this place out.

The coffee joint itself is very large with 2 stories and has sort of a lofty, urban, vibe to it. It holds plenty of tables and open workspaces (varying sizes for people flying solo or in large groups), and encourages their clients to have meetings in the shop or catch up on some e-mails during your breaks. The clientele ranges from suits to hipsters to dorky tourists (ahem) so I don't think anyone can really feel out of place in here.

The service was very quick and cashier was friendly. The barista was also quick - no artwork on the latte though - but made a good drink. I ordered a mocha which was very rich in chocolate with a hint of espresso. I thought it was quite delicious and for something categorized as a "small" it was pretty big in size - also a decent price.

Overall, I had a good experience at this coffee shop. The service was quick and efficient and the product (review based solely on the mocha!) was very good. I would definitely pop in again for a coffee the next time I'm in town and recommend others visiting SF to do the same.
author: Kat M.

description:
Interesting concept... Cafe, working center, conference rooms... All under one roof.
Love Peet's coffee
author: Sunny S.

description: love this place, love the little beanie bags and staff are friendly. my to go to cafe to work and study.
author: Taryn M.

description: This is an awesome cafe, not just for the coffee but also a comfortable place to rest and recharge while in the city. Any Capital One credit/debit card gets 50% off all coffee, which is a great deal. Staff are very friendly and there's plenty of place to sit, which is rare in the city.
author: Daniel K.

description: If you are a freelancer or a student like me, I don't think you can find anything better than this place it's like a treasure(not hidden). I have thanked my friend so many times who introduced me with Capital one cafe. Now I don't get to go there often, but there was a time when I used to work from this place four times in a week and if you are regular here, you start to feel like a family member as they celebrate different occasion n this place and you see familiar faces everyday and end up making friends. What can be a more delightful place to work in and guess what, its all free! They got peet's coffee, huge place, free wifi and plenty of charging ports. Although I mentioned free wifi, be ready to use your phones hotspot often as their wifi is very week usually. Not to forget, this place is located in the heart of Downtown!
author: Pratibha S.

description:
I'm incredibly dissapointed with my experience here. We came in for a quick snack and got lured into the $176 promotion if I signed up for a checking and savings account, and if my fiancé referred me he would get a $40 bonus. It was 5 when we walked in and we left at 6 pm (when they closed) and I was furious. Thinking this would be a quick sign up we said okay. Well, I was so very wrong.

I started setting up my savings account, only to find out I had to call their number to verify I was who I said I am. Even though I was physically there, with my ID. What was supposed to be a quick phone call turned into waiting on hold for 20 minutes to speak with someone. Fine, they verified my account and now it was time to set up my checking account. Well, even though I just went through the verification process on the savings account I had to do the exact same thing for the checking account, even though we were linking them. Another 20 minutes but this time the lady working there called, which led me to believe she might have been able to get through to someone sooner but nope, she just called the same number and waited. 

I had been talking to this lady and mentioned I just moved down from Canada. When she was telling me about the checking account she said I could have the overdraft option and I requested not to have it. If she had been paying attention, or knew how it worked she would have realized I needed a credit score in the states to qualify for the checking account. When they verified my account and tried to set it up I got rejected for no credit score. I've never needed a credit check for a basic checking account before, and my fiancé says it's for the overdraft protection which I stated I did not want and she let me know it was optional. 

After that she just kind of brushed us off and it was time to close up, so I left. My savings account was opened and the $76 was in there but we realized she never put my fiancé's account number in so he didn't get a referral bonus. Then the withdrawal from my main banking account (you needed to connect it to capital one and have $500 in your new savings account to get the bonus) was rejected by my bank and that bonus was taken away from my Capitol one account without a chance to correct anything. 

So overall an hour of my time was wasted, I left pissed off, the lady didn't do much or know much about how to help and I won't bother with Capitol one anymore.
author: Ayla W.

description:
What a great place!  This is a multi-level cafe with lots of seating, electrical outlets, good natural lighting, free wifi, long wood tables, and good drinks.  And the prices are so cheap --  $2 for soup, $2 for a cafe au lait, $3 for a latte, $1.25 for a cookie.  And no surcharge for substituting soy milk.  My friends also told me that this cafe often does deals and free food events.  For example I didn't have to pay for my drink because I checked in on Yelp.

I don't know what kind of deal this cafe has with Capital One (no rent? subsidies?) but I wish all banks did this.  Awesome.
author: C. C.

description:
Pros: Super friendly staff and huge space - even though there are so many people there, you can always find a spot for you since there are 3 floors!

Cons: It's closed during the weekends and the coffee is not the absolute best - although it's good enough for you to stay the whole day working there!
author: Mariana F.

description:
I love working from Capital One 360 Cafe for the following reasons:
1.  Great sitting & standing options. You can sit, you can stand, you can sit on a bean bag or in a little cove..there are plenty of options depending on your favorite work style.
2.  Good background music selection.  At least when I've been there I've enjoyed the music selection!
3.  The location is convenient, downtown.
4.  The staff is friendly.
5.  They have several choices for coffee/tea drinks & aren't rigid about bringing in food from the surrounding area to enjoy with your beverage.
6.  The wifi is strong & reliable.

I'll definitely keep stopping by here to work as long as they keep this up!
author: Mary L.

description: Peet's coffee and three levels of great work space make for a 5 star study spot.  Add in half price coffee when you use your Capital One card and this cafe is unbeatable!
author: Quin K.

description: Cool HUGE cafe! Three stories of space for you to lounge/work. Free wifi (no password required). My favorite place has got to be on the first level (go down the stairs after walking in the main entrance). They have a bunch of large bean bags or "fat boys" for you to lay around on to your heart's desire. :)
author: Ava S.

description:
What a great find! Packed at lunch (subsidized food and drinks) and plenty of spaces to work in a comfortable, fun environment. Impressed by this move Capital One, would definitely consider opening an account with you guys.

Appreciate the freebies as a newbie in SF. Another plus, conference rooms and clean bathrooms downstairs! 

Need I say more?
author: Grace C.

description:
The cafe is nice. Wifi is great, nice environment, music is too loud so I don't stay long. 

But... Capital One needs to pay more attention to basic bank services than the coffee and the wifi. It does not function as a bank, at least, not on the day I visited. Spark and this cafe need a visit from a usability consultant. Being able to take deposits is one of the most basic things a bank is supposed to do, and having a resilient technology set-up to enable the basics is just as important. It freaks me out that bank systems are this tenuous. NOT reassuring.

I am a Spark small business account customer. This cafe is all about supporting folks like us, right? I hoof it to this cafe, because it is my only means of depositing the first check my small business has received. Why? Because the Spark Business mobile app only supports i0S 8.0 or higher, and my phone only goes as high as 7.8. There is no mobile Web check deposit. I have to either buy a new phone, or hoof it. Since I like my $30/month iPhone plan very much, and didn't retire in my 30s by wasting money on stupid stuff, I'm not buying a new phone. So I go to the cafe, since I have this accidental business now, because taxes. Fine. 

I find all ATMs down. And there is no other way to deposit my check. There is no associate who can take my check, no other technology on-site to use to do it. One associate takes pity on me and offers me an employee iPad (set any security concerns with that aside for the moment). At least she tries. But oh, too bad, my check -- which is not even $7k, probably not unheard of for a month or so of work in San Francisco -- is too large to deposit, so I cannot use the employee iPad. 

So I sit, and wait for the ATM repair to come, and who knows when that will actually happen. Really folks? Really? 

I'm so close to canceling my account. Basic things have just been way too hard, even though the brand implies easy easy. Nope.
author: Zoe F.

description:
I love this place. It's everything capitalism in America should be.

Yesterday, I went it and got my coffees comped because my friend and I had a fun chat with the barista- he just said, "hey, this one's on the house, for fun". I love that the employees are given the power to do that- I so love a surprise! Even it it hadn't been free, the prices are SUPER reasonable, and a total steal if you pay with a capital one credit card (50% off). 

So, the business model is to delight people with cheerful employees, cheap prices, and freebies- and then slide in a few lines about either getting a capital one card or upgrading your account. I think it makes perfect sense- if you make me happy, of course you can do your pitch. And I've never been pestered about saying "no", which is totally impressive. My confidence in capital one is rising day by day, because of their excellent service and people standards. Good work, San Francisco.
author: Betsy B.

description: A great place if you need to kill some time in the financial area of the City. The place comes equipped with a built in Peets, ATM machines, and free WIFI. The area lets in a lot of natural light with all its windows, and fancy overhead lighting. You actually have three floors of space to hang out, so there should not be any problems in finding a comfortable place to park your behind. There's comfortable tables, chairs, and cushy sofas. If you need to do some heavy concentration, I would recommend the upstairs. Apparently nobody wants to take the hike one floor for peace and quite.  As for Peets, what can I say but that the servers are fast and cordial in getting your orders so the line moves at a steady pace.
author: Kurt C.

description:
This cafe/"get shit done" spot is even better than I thought it was. 

+ THREE FLOORS of tables, chairs, stools, bean bags, couches...!
+ Free WiFi
+ 50% off your drinks if you use your Capital One 360 debit card

Just an overall, awesome place to work/study/meet up folks downtown.
author: Joanna M.

description:
This place is a gem nestled in the heart of Union Square.  Stoked to find Capital One 360 Cafe.  Reasonably priced coffee, copious amounts of plugs, and environment conducive to productivity.  Great concept, Capital One!

Definitely will be back...just need to find a safer bike route home!
author: Christopher W.

description:
Great space in the middle of the action (Union Square).  Three floors of tables, power outlets, and free wifi.  Peets coffee is served here.

Plenty of couches, tables, and long tables in the space.  All are within reach of a power outlet or strip so you can camp out and work for hours if needed.  But it is in downtown SF so you still need to get here early or you might have to wait for a spot to open up.  There is a lot of traffic so if you are looking for a nice quiet coffee spot this may not be it for you.  No problems with the wifi during my few hours here.

Capital One card holders get a discount on purchases and a ATM is inside to do some quick banking (if needed).
author: Roy L.

description:
Always friendly baristas, plenty of places to sit and recharge devices. Always plan a stop here when I'm in San Francisco and need to recharge both myself and my gadgets. Bathrooms are downstairs and absolutely spotless. Conference room available on lower level. Convenient central location near Market St. In the heart of the Financial District. 

Delicious Americano for $2, too!
author: Lisa L.

description: I went to get some help for a new credit card. I met Bud, he is a banker and is just so personable and knowledgeable and helped me a lot. I highly recommend him for all your questions about checking, savings, or credit card help! He's very trusting and great guy!
author: Kris K.

description:
I feel a little silly writing a 5 star review for a cafe sponsored by a credit card company but here goes nothing!

From the moment you walk in, the 360 cafe is bright, clean, and welcoming. 3 floors of open and comfortable seating options, it seemed like there was a spot for everyone. Free wi-fi to boot makes this a dream WFC (work from cafe) spot. 

If you head to the actual cafe portion, there are some food options you can order in addition to typical beverages (coffee, tea, hot choco, juice, etc.). The guy I ordered from was amazingly nice and by the end of our convo, I felt like we were practically friends.

Capital One perks, your drink is half off if you purchase with your Capital One card. Nothing to hate about that. If Capital One wants to hook me up with a $1 hot choco that tastes like magic, party on credit card company, party on!
author: Rachel R.

description:
$2.50 for a large Pete's Coffee latte, need I say more?

This place is great. Aside from the half-price coffee for capital one customers the space is very nice. It's clean and wide open, with various types of seating including bean bags. You can imagine this place like a free, communal startup office with super cheap coffee.

Sometimes the Capital One employees will ask you for feedback on the company or something in the cafe. They are all super friendly and will even make an effort to remember your name if you go in often enough. The place definitely feels like it's primary goal is to increase goodwill toward CapOne and not to sign up new customers. I went into one of these before I was a member and they weren't pushy at all.

This is also a great spot for impromptu meetings of two or three people.

Five stars. Now we just need more of these around the country.
author: Ian S.

description: Staff at Peets Coffee was great except this place has the slowest wifi in the city. It takes 5 mins just for my web page to load. Definitely not coming back here to work.
author: Cindy K.

description: A large cafe right in the middle of the Financial District. The lighting was great, it wasn't too crazy, and I enjoyed the myriad of seating options. Last but not least, there is a large Peet's offering up a variety of snacks and drinks. Overall - I'm a fan.
author: Andreas H.

description:
I'm almost tempted to give this a 5---how cool is it to have this total hang out cafe, without really buying anything, to recharge your laptop/phone, etc. PLUS use the washroom downstairs (clean too), right in the heart of DT?!

Even saw a few ppl snooze on those bean bag-like chairs beneath the stairs...felt like a library at a university lol.  

Good thing they have smoothies (bottled ones) too.

Kudos to Capital One, but they can afford it anyways with those high credit card interest rates...
author: Kenneth N.

description:
'Whoa. '

That was my first word when I first stepped into this cafe. 
On days where I have work in the morning and need to find a place to get some studying before class at night, I am SO glad I've found this place. It's not your typical 'starbucks' setting. The whole place is big, nicely lit with tons of space! The drinks are super affordable and apparently theyre half off if you have a checking account with capital one....which is very tempting. 

I also approve of their music playlist. 

Anyways I think I just found my perfect study spot in downtown. :)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The friend who told me about this three-story free power and wifi tower called it a coffice: coffee + office, and that that's a pretty good description. I'm unimpressed by cheap coffee and free lunches, but the diverse seating options visible from the street finally seduced me inside. In the hour I spent there, I reclined on bean bags and giant pillows, hung out at communal bar tables, and rearranged modular couches to suit myself. I found the art interesting enough to actually direct my seating choices, even enough to pull me from the cushion options to the standing counters. 

I did have to listen to a little speech about getting an account with Capital One, but the nice gal who delivered did so with no pressure and made me feel more welcome. One weird thing--when I paid for my drink, the barista just swiped my card. No pin. No signature. What's up with that? He didn't offer me a receipt either, and I didn't ask, so hypnotized by his super-friendly chitchat.

Come to think of it, there was something vaguely cultish about the place. I'm talking about the friendliness, not the throw pillows. It's corporate cult, not hippie-California cult. It reminded me of the fabled employee lounges of the dot-com boom of the late '90s. The only thing missing was the ping pong table. 

When I made my security-and-receipt-free purchase, the barista did not offer me a wifi code. Since I changed seats so many times, it took my iPad and me a little while to figure out that I needed one. When I did realize it, I was very cozy in my perfectly arranged cuddly couch spot and really didn't want to get up and find a barista or a bank teller or whatever to help me with a code. Oh well, I was really there to write anyway.
author: Kristy L.

description:
This is my favorite chill spot when downtown/ FiDi.  What's not to like?  

-  They serve Peet's Coffee CHEAPER than Peet's...$1.50 for what's comparable to a Medium...FRIENDLY service!

-  The bankers/ baristas do not try to hard sell you at all but now that I am an ING customer, flashing my sexy ING card also means 50% OFF on all coffee drinks...HALLELUJAH for $1.50 lattes & mochas!

-  There's tons of space to lounge...FREE wifi, tons of tables to do work, TV with the news on, couches to rest on...the place is huge so no one is fighting you for personal space!

-  Only 1 star off because their pastry selection is a little lacking!  But with the new La Boulange just one block away...issue is insignificant!
author: Judy K.

description:
We ordered vanilla latte with almond milk, cafe au lait, caramel cinnamon latte and a matcha latte and they were all undrinkable.
Service was bad and orders got mixed up. I have never had such disappointing Peet's coffee.
author: Aishu P.

description:
Great place to work from! 

Free fast Wifi + Cheap (Peets) drinks + Lots of seating + Lots of outlets + Friendly staff

Bonus points:
They're pretty chill about letting you bring in food from outside 

Only downer is that they close at 6pm :(
author: jenn t.

description: Oh how I wish to work in the city again or just to be able to telecommute. This year, I volunteered for the 2014 Pistahan Parade and Expo and had their meet and greet at this location. This is a great space to work, have a impromptu meeting and also have a cafe that serves coffee and snacks.  I believe to my understanding, Capitol One 360 cafe offers their space after hours to non-profits to hold meetings which I thought I was pretty cool. I wouldn't mind visiting this place again if I'm ever in the city again.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: I go out of my way to come here every morning. Coffee shop, lounge, work space. I've used this place to change clothes for an interview.  The cafe is a full Peets coffee shop, and the coffee is half-price with a Capitalone card.
author: Neal W.

description:
Now that I've run my battery down from 100% to 20%, I'll leave a review.

This is a really nice place to sit down with a laptop and procrastinate. The atmosphere is like a cross between a cafe, a student union, and a hip modern startup office. Ample couches, cafe tables, and the lower level even has bean bag chairs!

The TV displaying a rotation of Capital One ads helps bolster the faceless white collar vibe. Literally only one hipster in the whole place! And he seems to be having a lunch meeting.

The only downside is their canned playlist of pop hits is really unconducive to productivity. Personally I find it hard to read and work when there's music playing that I know the words to. Literally every hit single of the past 50 years has played at least once. 

All in all, I wish there were more cafes like this around the bay area!
author: Ashley M.

description:
Fantastic place to work remotely. Incredibly cheerful staff. Lots of space, and strong, free internet. Props to Capital One, this is a fantastic concept. I work for a nonprofit and they have conference rooms nonprofits can reserve, and this is much appreciated.

Waffle snacks are surprisingly good. Please add chais to the cafe menu!
author: Sarah K.

description: Just got publicly shamed by someone behind the counter for taking a quarter out of the cup and putting a dollar tip in.  No good deed will go unpunished there so watch out!
author: Cassius D.

description:
All the yelp reviews I read prior to my first visit made me expect the cafe to be a lot bigger than it turned out to be. There are plenty seating and outlets if you're looking to get down and serious on those 'things' you gotta get done electronically. 

The espresso drinks are meh. The grab-to-go food looks kind of bland and shitty, to be honest, but this place wasn't made to serve gourmet food. It's a factory. It's where people go to produce great, wondrous ideas from their powerful human brains. 

Some innovate with fury, ferociously smacking their fingertips against their 21st century laptops and tablets. Some strike deals and have life-changing conversations yakking away on their savvy smartphones. Some watch and observe, chillaxin' in the midst of the hustle bustle.

Beautiful. 

It's a cafe nestled in the heart of the FiDi--
Ain't nothing like the rush of a city. 
Get inspired.
author: Colleen W.

description:
Spending a few hours here catching up on work is so pleasant it's easy to forget you're in the middle of the Financial District.  

Big, bright communal spaces, coffee and tea, internet, and nice staff - this place had done a great job of creating a work friendly atmosphere.
author: Melanie W.

description: Great place to come and complete some work! What made it even better is they were having happy hour when I was there (free drinks, any drink actually). I like how there's plugs everywhere and it's right in the heart of DTSF.
author: Joshua M.

description: This is my go-to place when I need to get some work done.  They have Peet's coffee and if you are a Capital One 360 account holder, you get 50% off beverages.  You will most likely find me here 2x a week.  Such a modern-tech looking cafe and very spacious.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
At first I wasn't sure what this was.  I saw "Capital One" and then I saw "Cafe".  I decided to try it out since I was wasting time.  

The barista/cashier filled me in where I was and I thought it was a pretty good idea. It had a very relaxing atmosphere, a ton of room to spread out and served as a great place to check email/read/study/chat.  

This is a great alternative to those big name coffee shops.  I recommend trying this "hotspot".
author: Nerick M.

description: I came in to get a snack and sit down for a minute and ended up getting some very useful information about banking options (as in, Capital One has ATMs everywhere, they're just not branded like that--they're in a lot of places like 7-11s).  Anyway, it was nice because when I got the free banking advice, they gave me my drink and snack for free. How nice! :)
author: Cassidy P.

description: If you're looking for a bright, cheerful coffee shop with wifi, this is the perfect spot. Always funny to grap a coffee in a bank branch!
author: Thibaut L.

description:
This is long overdue-- 

I've enjoyed the 360 Cafe since their opening day! The entire team is AMAZING. Besides knowing banking inside and out, they are helpful, thoughtful and always have something friendly to say (genuinely). 

I have a special place in my heart for Samik Roy, who has helped me with my small business decisions and always given me his undivided attention and solid advice. Thank you Samik!

If you're looking for a place to grab a coffee, quick lunch, free WiFi, a spot to call your own while you work, a set of conference rooms at your disposal, local art (very cool art, I must say), a place to host an event and a supportive environment--this is THE place.

I'm sure the big bank folks would love for me to mention the banking part--so...I am a Capital One card holder and I do my check/cash deposits and regularly talk with them about my accounts... However, I primarily go there for the people and the fun of it--they've created a unique community space where you can have it all - where business meets pleasure.
author: Shelley C.

description: I actually bank with Capital One and have their debit card as they don't charge international ATM Fees. This cafe is spacious with 3 floors of work space right in the heart of union square and free wifi. If you pay with your capital one debit card you get 50% off coffee drinks. In celebration of the July 4th holiday, I got a free mango iced tea and yummy chocolate and cherry waffle. Not much more you can ask for a cafe! They serve Peets coffee here which is my least favorite coffee in the city but other than that I love this place!
author: Betty C.

description: This place has free wifi, $2 coffee and lots of places to sit with plugs. The only downfalls could be the extremely mainstream radio music playing and the fact that you have to keep reconnecting to the wifi every so often.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Love the space, friendly staff and Peet's selection of pastry goodies and hot/cold drinks. It's my daily coffee spot. A few weeks back, I think one of their machines broke, so they gave out free drinks coupon for the delayed customers. Perfect example of great, responsive customer service.
author: cassy f.

description:
DOPE CAFE. Lots of seating, outlets, and customer service is on point.  Came in on a Wednesday early afternoon & found a seat pretty quickly.  I was unable to check in with my phone & the cashier gave me my large iced tea on the house :D  I will definitely be back.  Perfect environment to GSD once you get in the zone.

Tried their salted caramel waffles - only downside - wish they were warm.  Alongside the pastries, they also had a variety of healthy pre-packed meals like kale salad and wraps.  Overall 5 stars (:
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
The Capital One 360 cafe is built like a college workspace and I love it.

They have three floors of innovative, comfy seating areas, wickedly fast, FREE wi-fi, lots of spots to plug-in, hunker down, and get your work done...or just chat it up!  On any given weekday, I am sure you will meet some young go-getter, ready to pitch their start-up idea to you.  As for me, I just needed to a change of scenery from the old office.  I wound up spending the rest of my afternoon taking my meetings, answering emails, and working through my readings.

They have Peet's mango iced tea for $.75 for Capital One cardholders or $1.50 for non-cardholders.  Such a steal and a great way to fuel my day!

The fantastic and friendly staff will whip up a good drink as well as a decent sales pitch to open an account.  I did and even got a free mug. :)

I am such a fan and will definitely be back whenever I need a workspace in FiDi.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
A friend of mine took me here for the first time since it was right across the street from his office building, and I was completely blown away by how nice this place was. The architecture and design is amazing. Very modern decor with great lighting, free wifi, and lots of glass which made the place look very open. The entire place is very trendy and there are always a lot of young professionals who visit this place often.

There are three levels and there is seating and plugs everywhere. You see a lot of people working, hashing out deals, and generally coming up with great ideas. There is an area with really nice plushy seating if you really want to kick back and relax. 

I did not get a good look at their food menu, but the iced coffee I got was good and they gave me a pretty large cup of it considering the price I paid. I think they serve Peet's Coffee actually. 

Good place to come and get some work done (as all the current patrons seem to use this place as a second office). It might be a little difficult to find a place to sit down but if you hover around, a spot will usually open up relatively quickly.
author: Julie Z.

description: Big, spacious, clean, clean, clean. Seating isn't as plentiful as you would imagine, but location and space makes this place awesome!!
author: Alex S.

description: Love your café. We would love to have you come to Napa. Napa has grown two fold just in the last five years with new hotels coming down town, it would be a great opportunity to expose Napa to Capital One!
author: Keely D.

description: Friendly staff. Prompt service. Good inexpensive coffee at 1.50.  Try the bStreet waffles. Free first Wed 9am.
author: Margaret W.

description: A great multi-level cafe, perfect for getting work done or meeting up with someone. My only critique is that they should serve warm food (i.e., bagels) and more perishable food, as I was a bit hungry when I went, but they only had a limited selection of perishable food.
author: Sofia M.

description:
Cheap Decent Coffee (Even Cheaper if you have a Capital One Debit Card)

3 floors of seating areas.

free wifi.

2 Conference Rooms on the bottom floor.
author: Steven F.

description:
I like to spend about an hour every morning before work working on side projects and taking care of personal business. I've tried other coffee shops in the area (I really liked the various Specialty's Coffees in the area), but nothing is as good as the Capital One 360 Cafe.

The space is really nice, the drinks are well-priced (and, bonus: they're 50% off if you have a Capital One 360 card), and the team at the counter is really friendly.

About a year ago I was toying with closing my account at Capital One 360, just to simplify things, but this place is so fantastic, there's no way I'm closing my account now.
author: Charlie P.

description:
Pros: Great location, decent coffee, good atmosphere

Cons: The proxy for their wi-fi does not play nicely with Linux and I struggle each time I come. Booting OSX or Windows works fine, however their proxy service rarely works with Linux unless you do a lot of manual tweaking -- this for me is a deal breaker because I develop in Linux and can't do work here. Also use a VPN b/c their network isn't secure.
author: Vincent S.

description: I love this place. Free working space with great coffee. What more could you ask for!
author: Oscar M.

description:
This review is for about a year ago.  I received an e-mail invitation for a Roth IRA event.  Only having a standard 401(k) through work I was definitely interested!  I have two accounts through Capital One (one being through the former ING Sharebuilder) so I wanted to check it out.  

There were free appetizers that were actually really fancy!  You know, the kind where the person serving it to you tells you that you have to put the whole spoon in your mouth so you can enjoy all the explosions of flavor?  There were standard beverages and the food came throughout the presentation.  They even had raffles for electronics.  I think they gave away a few Kindle Fires.  The presenters answered questions from everyone in the crowd and it wasn't over crowded.  Something I was afraid would happen because of the "Free Food" announcement in the e-mail.  I actually learned a lot from the presentation and didn't feel any pressure to sign up for anything new.  If you ever get an invitation for one of these events I strongly suggest attending.  

The overall experience was great!  I've been wanting to go back just to enjoy the cafe amenities.  It's in a very convenient location in the Financial District  so stop by on your way home and grab a coffee or something small.  I hear the baristas are bankers, too!
author: Durty D.

description: Genius marketing move. I've had CapitalOne cards for years, never thought one way or the other about the issuing vendor. This spacious, easy to use cafe changes that completely - I'll now choose CapitalOne cards whenever I have a choice.
author: Ceil T.

description: Great place to work!  Much like a coworking space... only it is FREE!  Very good place to get things done. Great find. Many startups and entrepreneurs are here as they go between VC meetings. Interesting conversations.
author: Olin H.

description:
It's a cafe. No, a workplace. No, a bank!? It's all of these things, but my experience has been that it's a nice space no matter what you visit it for. I belong to a professional network, and we regularly host events in this space. 
The drawback? No alcohol on the premises, but it's clean, spacious and we're always greeted by friendly staff. 
The drinks aren't bad, either. I've dropped by for an ice tea on one of SF's more recent unseasonably warm afternoons, and it was refreshing as expected. Consider this your alternative to the stuffy, loud, crowded Starbucks that are splattered about the city.
author: Kelly B.

description: Get the mango iced tea :) it's refreshing and tastes great without sugar! I liked the cafe a tad more when it was called ING Direct. All the baristas here are very nice. Matt likes college ball, which makes for fun small talk.
author: Carina M.

description:
Really nice study place! I think this is my new escape spot when I don't want to be studying on campus/cafes near campus. There's just something motivating about a good work environment (LOTS OF OUTLETS+TABLES+SPACE), being in the fin district, and being surrounded by people talking business. 

The guy @ the register was also very personable. Even gave me flavored syrup in my iced tea for free! :) It was also the weekend before cinco-de-mayo when I went, and they were giving out free virgin margaritas AKA slushies, which I thought was nice of them. 

Very close to an H&M and some other stores, and a walk away from the rest of Union Square ... which is a very nice treat after some serious studying heh. 

Will definitely be back again!
author: Ashley N.

description:
I don't know how they can do it - staff a full-service coffee bar with licensed financial services professionals, ready to help you open your online account.  It's brilliant, if it works!  A must for anyone seeking a FI-DI respite.

The "Cafe" is full of wi-fi connected literati, working away, meeting in corners, sippin' on caffeine.  The noise level is surprisingly low, but ear buds are still de rigueur. Despite this de-humanizing aspect, the vibe is good - focused and productive but amiable.

Stop in between meetings, catch up on email, fine-tune your presentation.  Then sign up for an online checking account.  This is the "new bank".
author: Dave C.

description:
I love the friendliness of this cafe. When you walk into the door, people will greet you and smile. Also service is efficient too.

Tried the maple bacon waffle and its awesome. When you bite open the waffle, bits of bacon and sweetness of maple come out, pure enjoyment. Will definitely come back again!
author: Mau Kwong Marco C.

description:
Agree with another reviewer - cool concept, really awesome space with great natural light, ample seating choices, nice furnishings, and a pleasant atmosphere.  But they are using some hokey wifi system that does not play nicely with Linux.  Since I, too, develop on Linux that is a deal-breaker if I want to do work at the cafe.  

Three stars for now.  If they fix the wifi, five stars without reservation.
author: Jason M.

description:
Whenever I'm here, I feel like I might overhear a great tech idea or company being born. That's the way it is here--people who look like they're in the start up world working away, meeting other interesting folks, and hanging out in the conference rooms downstairs. 

Whether or not secret tech deals are being hashed out here, I'm just minding my own business on my laptop. While the food is not amazing, it's enough to get you by when you're working on a deadline. Coffee is relatively cheap, considering their location and the size of the cup, and even cheaper if you're a banking customer. The only slight gripe is that you have to re-enter the internet password every 45 minutes or so. But if I'm spending hours here, that's the least I can do.
author: Pauline S.

description: Free wifi, plenty of seating, clean and spacious - and the coffee was free. What more could you want. Still trying to figure out where the actual banking was getting done in this establishment that all but looks like a cafe and not a bank branch!
author: Jason M.

description:
I've walked by the cafe so many times, but I never had a chance to stop in. I decided to make a pit stop for coffee one morning since I was curious what this place was. 

This place used to be an ING cafe, but it changed to a Capital One cafe a few months back. There's a little cafe in the corner on the first floor with pastries, breakfast sandwiches, sandwiches boxed up to-go, a variety of bottled drinks, and of course coffee -- Peet's coffee! I got a latte for about $3.50. 

The space is pretty big and there's an upstairs and downstairs. I didn't venture up or down, but there's free wifi in here along with tables and chairs. If I could, I would definitely grab my laptop and do work from here instead of at the office...must be nice to be able to work in a different atmosphere. I know that communal workspaces are more common in the LA area, but it's nice to see that Capital One has done this with their cafe here in SF!

+Friendly staff
+Fast service
+Peet's coffee
+free wifi
+plenty of seating...great for getting some work done away from the office (definitely a bonus for folks who are in SF on business and need a workspace!)
author: Katherine S.

description: Great place if you have a couple of hours in between errands. Clean restrooms, a lot of light and outlets so you can recharge your devices.
author: Mili S.

description: What a  great secret coffee/study/remote work spot in downtown SF! I love how random it is and the coffee is pretty high quality as well. Who doesn't enjoy working remotely from a long, sturdy farm table for a few hours?
author: Erin W.

description: New favorite place in the Financial District when I need WiFi.  I haven't figured out the business model yet which is being able to offer three spacious floors of "study/work" space for people to enjoy while selling Peet's Coffee for less than a couple bucks.  There are even rooms in the lower level for larger groups of people to use for meetings and whatnot.  If you're looking for a wider variety of coffee options, you might want to look elsewhere at a conventional coffee shop but ING Direct Cafe will be my destination place when I'm in the FiDi for work!
author: Albie F.

description:
Great workspace- the good acoustics help dim the sound of the person at the table next to you, making their very important skype call to their significant other who is in their towel in some foreign country.

Good drinks- and seriously cheap.  Even cheaper if you pay for it using your capital one card- 50% off!

Nice people- although they're really not your typical baristas with big glasses and purple hair, they sure are nice.  Snobby is not a word to describe the employees behind the counter.
author: Betsy B.

description:
This cafe is awesome! They brew peets coffee and give pretty generous cups for a great price. If you're already an ING customer you also get a discount off their coffee. In addition they have a selection of pastries, yogurt, and salads and sandwiches during lunch time. 

The space is really big and is open for the public to use. PLUS they often give away free food such as during their bbq bonanza last month where they gave out coffee in the morning, pulled pork sliders and cupcakes for lunch, and iced tea in the afternoon! Last week they gave out free waffles from a food truck. Definitely worth stopping by and there are plenty of staff members available if you need assistance with your account or want to become a customer.
author: Alice J.

description: This café is awesome - a great place to hang out.  Also, if you use your capital one card, all drinks are 50% off.  So, I only pay $1.50 for my soy latte.  Soy latte and the b waffle and never ending stream of people to stare at makes it a great café.
author: Wakako U.

description: This place is real neat.  Lots of space and free wi-fi.  I sat in a comfortable seat, had a great view of a busy street corner, enjoyed my coffee, and pumped out some work on my lap top (there were several outlets available too if you need to plug in).
author: Bret M.

description:
If you bring in your own mug, your drink is 1/2 off. 
So, I walked away with a Medium Peet's coffee for .75 cents.

Winner!
author: Jon F.

description: Nice peeps, very cool interior setup but watery coffee! It did not taste like a true Peets brew. I'm gonna hit up the real Peets next time.
author: Thomas L.

description:
This place is really awesome if you're looking for a place to get crap done. There are 3 floors, tons of seats, plenty of outlets, and 50% off drink discounts if you use your Capital One card. I didn't have to use a 360 card (since I don't have one), but it's good to know that there's that discount. The only food I've ordered from here was an Orange Vanilla waffle, but... they didn't heat it up or anything. So far this is my only gripe since cold, hard waffles aren't very fun to eat, but the pros outweigh the cons.

The staff doesn't come around to bug you, so you don't really need to feel obligated to buy anything. If you do, they won't even really bug you about opening an account, so another plus. This is my go-to spot when I visit SF and I needsta work!
author: Patrick K.

description: Maybe the best coffee shop in the area. Appears to be run by Peets but still as spacious as ever and filled with the same friendly staff. The baked goods blow away that faux french (la boul) offered by a nearby competitor, as does the strong coffee. Prices are right.
author: Boris G.

description: Great spot to do some work remotely. 3 floors of tables, tons of outlets, they even have bean bag chairs downstairs (reminds me of college). You're guaranteed to find a spot easily and the wifi connection is good. There's a Peetes coffee shop inside, and to top it off it's super centrally located in the heart of downtown. What it lacks 'character' (don't expect cozy and cute, it's opened by a bank after all) it makes up in convenience, functionality and efficiency. Big fan of this spot.
author: Denise W.

description: THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT THE FOOD/DRINKS OFFERED ONLY: So, they closed for a week for a remodel and to improve the café.  I specifically walked all the way over there to check out the new remodel and pickup my favorite salad.  What a huge huge disappointment to walk in there and basically see a "Peets" Coffee in it's place.  Gone are the delicious local food offered and $1.50 coffee.  Now you can get a lentil salad for $6.75 made in some anonymous place god knows when and where.  I went in there for the great and fast service.  I guess all the folks who want to just sit there for the wifi and have their meetings will continue to go....folks who like real, local food at normal prices will have to find somewhere else to go....no more great vegan food :(
author: Maria E. M.

description: Great spot in SF to get work done on the weekday! It seems to cater more toward providing a work and meeting place for people rather than earning profit from their food, so drinks and snacks are super cheap, staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, interior is bright and open, and there are lots of outlets and couches! I wouldn't feel bad coming here regularly just to get a cup of coffee and studying.
author: Hannah C.

description: Capitol one 360 coffee shop is cool.  Lots techies work from this place. Free wifi and great snacks and lattes.  I think more companies need to consider burning all their stupid cubicles and make their white collar workspaces look like this place.
author: Robert C.

description: Called in today to see if I can stop by and make a payment on a credit card and was told that I couldn't make it at this location but the guy named Pat on the phone was great! He immediately gave me all the alternatives and made sure I knew everything about how and where I can take care of my credit bill. Very happy with the customer service, great job definitely going to stop by and check this place out. Give Pat a " Pat on the back" .
author: Adam R.

description: So I found out that this ING does not have a branch, it's all online. But this location is just a Cafe. For people to go and either join ING banking or hangout.. I was early for a meeting and walked a few blocks around and could NOT find a place to sit, I walked into ING and just hung out to kill time. No one bothered me. I saw a few groups doing client meetings in there as well. Pretty cool!
author: Tam T.

description:
ING did a great job with this place!
spacious, comfortable seating, outlets everywhere, wi-fi, TVs, food
i love that the furniture is all sustainable
it's a great place to work, chill for a few minutes while shopping, meet people, or just grab a coffee
and the bankers/baristas are very friendly
author: Deka M.

description: What an AMAZING gift this is to people trying to start their own business. Free wifi, tons of outlets, tons of seating, and coffee. I'm so thankful for this space. I hope they make a video series someday about the startups that blossomed from this space. :)
author: Julie N.

description: Great place if you need a physical bank for your 360 account. I haven't received direct deposit yet from a new job, so I've been getting cash. I needed to pay mu credit card bill and the process was explained quickly and thoroughly. Definitely very friendly and helpful.
author: Daniel M.

description:
It's a bank. It's a coffee/snack shop. It's a lounge. It's a wifi cafe. It's Superrr...

A cool and modern take on banking. Imagine a Starbuck's where the coffee is half-priced, the baristas are moonlighting as banking associates, and the interior is huge & well-kept in a prime location! That's what 360 Cafe is.

Capital One 360 (formerly ING Direct, RIP) is an online-only banking institution. They do not have the traditional branches you expect from Bank of America, JP Morgan Chase, etc. What they do have is a really awesome online experience and really cool cafe/banks to go with it. There's only a handful of these and they're all located in metropolitan areas.

Drinks are also 50% off if you use your Capital One 360 debit card.

I enjoy this place for what it provides, ample spacious areas to do work, friendly service and exceptionally priced coffee, and a clean environment in an envious downtown location.

5-stars if you're looking for something different than Starbuck's but will still give you the caffeine and work space you've grown accustomed to.
author: D K.

description: Ok I'm sure the coffee holds its own but the banking is little to be seen. I have had Ing direct and when it transformed into CapitalOne 360 it wasn't too complicated just moving passwords and resetting a few common applications, in addition I have a Capital One Credit Card to boot and connect with. But just recently I have had multiple problems with this bank; They continue to freeze my account for normal transactions at what they say are questionable atms (Atms on their allpoint network), they don't have their own atms btw only at this 1 location. And after speaking on the phone with multiple representatives who would only deflect the blame to MasterCard or the Allpoint atm network that is "supposed" to be used, I decided to pop in and ask a person face to face. Let me warn you here I think these "assistants" might be less qualified then the Baristas. I almost question there existence in total! The most they could do is put me on the phone with another representative and hand me a pair of free sunglasses. Even when I was finished with the phone call I was given 3 free coffee cards for my trouble and lack of help/information. If I need coffee I'll use a bank that let's me access my funds properly and proceed with a debit purchase. If I need banking I'll use...to be determined...
author: Daniel M.

description: Wifi was a bit trippy in the beginning but it worked fine after 10 minutes or so. It's conveniently located in the heart of downtown and it has THREE floors! The set-up is rather cute actually. There's bean chairs, swanky chairs, and yoooooo - $1.50 large iced coffee! You can't beat that price It doesn't taste watered down either. That's wassup.
author: Annie S.

description:
Came here for the first time and like it so far. It's definitely easier to concentrate in here than a typical cafe with wifi, especially coming here at noon on a weekday. Coffee is $1.50 for a large. I wasn't able to find a table but found a really comfy chair in the lower level to camp out.  

Complaints: not liking the 90's music at all. There's a time and a place for that, aka while dancing around my living room or hanging out at a dive bar, not while working! :)

Also, wish they were open later than 6 and/or on weekends.
author: Jade S.

description:
They're doing a lot of things right at this not-too-little cafe.  I'll admit to being suspicious at first since cafes that are banks that are cafes that are banks tend not to get either part right (hello, Starbucks-Wells Fargo!).  

But I was wrong.  The space is bright and airy.  The staff is efficient and friendly.  I haven't hung out with my cuppa since my office is right across the street, but there's a lot of real estate to enjoy with a laptop.  

Best reasons to visit:  Never a line, great prices, fast wi-fi.
Best reasons not to visit:  Agoraphobia, caffeine intolerance.
author: Ryan P.

description: Good service, plenty of space, and half off if you have a capital one card.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Bank on it.

My favorite bank is now one of my favorite cafes.

This clever marketing move means everyone has a new spot downtown to enjoy solid Thai chicken salads from Curbside, good Americanos made awesome with sugar free dark chocolate and one of the cheapest parfaits ($2) in the city.

WiFi throughout. Plenty of open space, seating, outlets and friendly vibe.

Consider it a good investment.
author: Jason B.

description: Seriously, the best wifi here! As a traveller I have been looking for good internet for a few days now. I managed to download a whole season of Broad City in under 20 minutes! This really made me happy. Oh, and the water is good too.
author: Ben M.

description:
Surprisingly really quite nice. It was the closest coffee place open on a Saturday by my new office, so I tried it out.  SUPER friendly barista.  Decent prices (relatively speaking), super open space, good coffee.  I don't really write many yelp reviews anymore, but I felt compelled since it was such an unexpectedly pleasant experience. 

I guess I also get 50% off coffee there too if I pay with my ING debit card, which I happen to have already have.  Who knew!

Mostly the dude was just so excited and nice - it was very refreshing!
author: Kerry L.

description: Really nice place to use wifi and purchase many of their good eating options. The place can get VERY crowded as in everybody using the wifi and seating, just be on the look for when a space is available. I just wish they would extend their hours.  Perhaps my favourite place for wifi and a nice chilled coffee.
author: Nadav M.

description: what a great place to just sit down, enjoy a great cup of latte and just do work! Staff were great, ambiance is nice, and even get some tips on how to save money.  what a place. highly recommended.
author: Alan W.

description:
Great, we all love this coffee place.
Easy, convenient, cheap, and great coffee.
Perfect!
author: Oleg K.

description: I feel ashamed every time I come here because most of the time I just use their electricity and internet without even buying a coffee. Great place to study or do some work on your laptop and cheap cafe onsite. Also very centrally located next to all the restaurants nearby and the workers don't even give you dirty looks when you bring in outside food or drinks!
author: C W.

description: It's our lovely place! Good Peet's Coffee and there are a lot of sitting place including downstairs (with pufs), main floor and second floor! It's an ideal place for working, briefly casual meetings and just for sitting in the center of SF. Be sure that there are a good WiFi and a lot of people with laptops like this is the main office of Google :))
author: Ilia S.

description:
This is a great place to have a meeting with someone or do some work. They have free wifi if you buy a drink. It's very spacious and has a lot of tables. Sometimes, if you don't get there early enough, the larger tables (that fit 4-6 people) upstairs are already taken up.

Drinks are 50% off with ING Debit card, can't beat it!

All the people who work there are also very friendly, and knowledgeable about ING products, if you need help with them.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Capital One took over ING, 
same friendly people, new uniform....
maybe they can open longer hours,,,

anyway, it's 99% perfect,
if I worked next door,,,,I'll be "DRUNK" every day on hot chocolate!  yum
author: Sunny O.

description: Free drink if you check in! This place is the coolest work-from-home-but-not-really place. It is a strange concept and I don't really see the banking part of it (besides all the posters and commercials) but it's awesome! The people who work there are so nice. There's all these tables and outlets to work at with their free wifi and the coffee is cheap but good!
author: Melissa T.

description: A spacious, fun place to work downtown.  The 50% discount for using your Capital One 360 card makes it almost too good to be true.
author: Krishan G.

description: Finally! After weeks of searching for a cool quiet cafe to work or study, I came across this place. And it's almost perfect for someone who's looking for a quiet cafe with music on low volume and plenty of seating and numerous power charging slots. They have high bar chairs to work with your laptop and also couches to relax. High ceiling and plenty of sunlight. There's Peet's coffee outlet.
author: Mohit C.

description: Like the environment easy to work good music but don't expect fast internet.
author: Cemal S.

description: The internet is fast. That's about what I can say about this space that's an unqualified positive. It's not bad, it's just absolutely average. Average coffee, average seating, average music.
author: John B.

description: Interesting to see a bank aiming for the coffee crowd.  It makes some sense to me.  If people can spend upwards of $3 for a cup of coffee, you may as well exercise the "Capital" portion of the name and go after it.  It's actually a nice vibe.  Coffee is good, Pastry is what you might expect.  I'm all for anyone putting a little dent in the $tarbuck$ business.  Just sort of funny to see a bank in the java biz.  My prediction is that it won't last long. though I'm rooting for them.
author: Joe I.

description: This place was awesome. Nice place to get away during work and get some cheap espresso. Lately the network had been horrible. They need to limit what people can download or boost the capabilities. Torturously slow this week. Will need to find a new haunt. I'm a Capital One customer too so this especially ticks me off.
author: Aaron N.

description: Can't really complain when the place offers free wifi, but it lacks atmosphere and there isn't enough seating.
author: Kira G.

description:
Half off all PRISSY coffees because I have a capital one card. Carmel Mocha, yup. 

Mason is the Banker that signed me up. He is the nice little Asian dude like me.
author: James B.

description: like the coffee shop im a capitol one card holder and used to bank with them when i lived in Houston and New Orleans so im a fan, love the wifi and coffee here
author: Leigh G.

description: This cafe feels super-Financial District with hipster-modern thrown in for comfort. Food and drinks are super cheap and the wifi is pretty consistent. It really does feel like an open-plan office, which is a nice change though usually I'm not into an office feel. :)
author: Allison L.

description: This is such a cool place!  I work one block from here and I find myself here everyday.  My fav part about the spot is the space: It has a really hip interior and there are always people just lounging around and hanging out.  Much better space than any other coffee shop I have found in the city.  The only "issue" is that their coffee is mediocre at best.  However, I am not a big coffee person, and as I alluded to early, I come here because of the awesome atmosphere.
author: Simon L.

description: A great place to sit and study and do work. This place has a great feeling. There are also cool art exhibitions all the time here.  The wifi is fast and free. You don't have to buy anything to use it. So chill. Love it.
author: Alanna R.

description: Love this public coworking place with free wifi and reasonably priced coffee. I'm a freelance marketing consultant, so I like to mix it up which cafe I work from, and this place is by far one of the best places where I was able to work productively. If I want to take a break, I can go to the downstairs level and take a nap on one of the beanbags :) Coffee is ok, and hot tea (lemon rose and xiao blend are my favorites) are only $1.50. Great place to meet with clients or hold business meetings at too!
author: Eni R.

description:
Came in today as I constantly walk by - and went up to the counter where Stephanie the friendly barista was able to help me sign up for a bank account and offered me a free beverage as well.

After fiddling with the wifi for about 10 minutes - we got it to work. Overall, signing up for the account was a breeze; drinks are cheap; and i thought it was a great place with all of the power outlets.
author: Brian D.

description:
As someone below said, this is first and foremost a bank. Capital One bought ING and service has gone way downhill from there. They put FIVE BUSINESS DAY holds on deposited checks, even payroll checks (I know, I know; why does my employer even do paper checks?) And going to this cafe doesn't make the hold time any shorter. It's exactly the same hold they use for mobile banking. 

I'm not working just so that Capital One can use my money for a week before they give it to me. 

Time for a real brick-and-mortar bank for me.
author: C D.

description:
It's like being in a huge office with young, trendy co-workers (think start-up folks) whom you never talk to ever. It's big and spacious with plenty of electrical outlets. Free wi-fi and very cheap coffee (Peet's!): $1.50 for what would usually be a medium at most places. The workers here don't guilt you into buying anything or even to join their bank. Such a chill place to work. 

There are also conference rooms you can reserve for free (what, I know). Only drawback is, I wish they had better food.
author: Trish P.

description: What a great idea.  This will be my new "go to" place downtown when I need to get some work done.
author: Paul M.

description: stunning facility but seems like I can't sit here for more than 45 minutes before the waiter kicks me out to make room for the Promotional Event of the Week. Also, is this a coffee shop, a daycare or a bank?
author: O. Reli-yah S.

description: I love this place. I don't drink coffee but I'm a big tea fan and they have great a great chai latte. It's very strong but you can always ask for more milk (or non-dairy milk). The prices are fantastic and the people are really friendly. the ambiance is great because there are 3 floors you can use and there is plenty of spots to do your work or use your laptop.
author: Tayo O.

description: Friendly baristas, pretty inexpensive coffee and free (and fast wifi).  Love how they have check in specials too (yelp and foursquare) so make sure you do and get your coffee on!  If you open an account you get 50% off?!!!
author: Mari Dani B.

description: Comfortable place to work with a Peet's Cafe inside.  Lots of tables with outlets to plug in your laptop.  Only downside is the Wi-Fi is very spotty, so be prepared for that (phone tethering is a life saver).
author: Cy C.

description: Always friendly and fast. The cheapest iced coffee in town also the food (salads, sandwiches etc) is always fresh and tasty.
author: Kendra R.

description: Came here for "Free salted caramel waffles" last week and stayed to open a savings account because ALL the baristas are bankers (formerly known as ING). While I sipped on my free latte, I opened a savings account & will get my hubby to get one too. GREAT place, very chill environment and not to mention they were playing Snoop Dog & Biggie in the back round.
author: Yishra L.

description: This is my absolute favorite place to study in the city. It's a huge open space and there's always a seat available. AND how can you beat a large cup of Peet's coffee or tea for $1.50 (and I believe $.75 if you are an ING customer). The soup changes daily and is pretty good, the wraps are delicious and fresh as well. I especially love the pesto chicken wrap with avocado and arugula. Thank you ING!!!
author: Peggy L.

description: I don't know what kind of force field or black magic they're using, but these guys have the first clean, publicly accessible restroom I have ever seen in downtown San Francisco.
author: Coleman F.

description:
ever notice when you enter a local coffee house, that it is:
- dark
- cramped
- all of the above?

not ING Direct Cafe
you'll get many degress of "whoa" when you enter this place.
the confines are vast and chasm like.
the coffee is good, the side-eats are nice.
the staff is uber-friendly.
the feng-shui is perfect.
feels like I stepped in some modern-day euro coffee pad with banking on the side.
author: Derek N.

description:
Awesome idea; and it is well executed.
I hope the idea works for them as well as it works for me. 
Clean space
Fast internet
Not noisy
Fast, friendly service
... and yes you'll be pitched a Capital One product or two while you are here, but it is a bank after all. 
Just manage your expectations.  If you want Capital One to pick up the cost for your internet and most of your coffee ... well give them at least an opportunity to share their bank offerings with you as well. 
If you don't want to be bothered with bank offers go to peet's or starbuck's do the road. Noisy, slow internet, and expensive coffee.
author: Hennie S.

description: They play the absolute worst music. Most people are there working, not clubbing with teenagers.
author: Chris E.

description: This is a great cafe for sitting down and doing some work.  Cheap food and drinks, super spacious, wifi, tables, sofas and even conference rooms.
author: Vincent V.

description: This cafe is a great spot to sit down and get some work done. Wifi works great, never got disconnected and was sitting there working remotely for about 4 hours. Coffee's nothing special, but it's good. The staff is awesome. At around closing time, I went to grab a bottle of water before leaving and the barista gave it to me for free! Well done capital one, well done.
author: Paul S.

description: Pretty unique place. Very cheap coffee with a Capital One card, no serious lines to order, great setup (lighting, tables, sofas) for informal meetings and catchups, bustling atmosphere. My favorite spot for a coffee break
author: Eric S.

description: How does this place even exist?  It's like a free office in the heart of SF with tons of room, WiFi, power, coffee, and snacks.  The people are friendly and love to comp you stuff too.  This place saved me on a day that I need to get tons of work done out of my normal New York office.  Highly recommended.
author: Karim O.

description: can't beat a place where you can sit and use the wifi for hours and for free! decent bathrooms, fairly quiet, and if you're a capital one customer, major discounted coffee! good place to work in SF proper.
author: RayRay P.

description: Lov this cafe! Spacious, super friendly Baristas, just one block away  rom my work. And I only paid $1.75 for a large cup of Mocha (with my Capital One card). Wow, I think I will be here several times a week if not daily. It would be great if I can tour the third and fourth floors, the decors look fantastic.  But I heard they are only for internal employees!
author: Christine M.

description: Pretty great place to grab some wifi, a spot to work for a few hours, or even a convenient meeting place.  Half off drinks when I use my Capital One credit card.  With Peets, the drinks are good.  Sure, it's no Blue Bottle, but $1 is not half bad for an espresso and spacious place to work for 3 hours.
author: Caricia C.

description: Maybe they were having a bad day when I went in the morning. But damn the girl who took my order was pms'ing big time and had negative energy written all over her, she was very rude. I waited 20 minutes just to get a muffin and a regular coffee and there were 3 people behind the counter wtf. Looks like they cater more to tailor made corporate folks. Ive been coming to this place since it first opened and never really had an issue or complaint until now. Im pretty disapointed that the level of service was not up to par on the day I went.
