Normally I wouldnt make a big deal out of its since its just f@#$en coffee but they made me late for work and that pissed me off.
author: Flechazo I.

description:
Interesting concept.. We were waking by it, and just had to peak in to see what exactly their offering was.  Cheap coffee and banking advice from the baristas.

Nice decor and plenty of seating space - not crowded.  Will be back if I ever pass by again.
author: Gary V.

description: Since last year had great improvement in making the space more suitable for working, cheap coffee and good environment. I'm glad that music is not too loud and Internet connection is a lot better now. Still I'm not a fan of their playlists when I want to work or have an appointment. But it's a great place in financial district to have a coffee, meet someone or get some work done.
author: Siavash F.

description: Great place to get some work done or for a tasty drink. The location is prime as well, a block away from Union Square. Bonus: the prices are great, the check in makes it better (50% off). I even got a drink on the house after checking in a couple times (I think it's random). No complaints.
author: Nathan M.

description: I've been considering joining a co-working space, as an alternative to working from home (I'm self-employed), and a friend tipped me off to this space. It is airy and spacious, and lots of light, tables and reliable Wi-fi. I feel more productive as there are lots of other self employed tech people plugging away at their laptops, which is motivating! There is Capital One marketing all over the place, and a bit of the push to try their banking but it isn't too bad. I guess it is their "experiential marketing" to the tech/start-up demographic. You also need to input the password to the Wi-fi every 45 mins, but it is easy. Agree with the other reviewer, that the food could be better. Overall, I am pretty stoked... the music isn't bad either!
author: Jungah L.

description:
Things I love about this bank / cafe:

- They have a sign that says "We proudly serve cap & trade coffee."
- You can order your latte with whole milk, skim, or 2.9%.
- This place has an espresso machine with a panic button.
- I hear they have an opening for a bean counter.
- You can get your coffee free every month as long as you always keep 2 oz. in your thermos. 
- On their most recent menu, they dropped the Americano in favor of the Euro.
- When customers refer to their portfolio, they don't mean a book of really ironic t-shirt designs.
- ING Cafe doesn't have musical performances, but they do have a variety of instruments.
- There's nothing like a nice cup of coffee to go with your pie chart.
- They sponsored a "coffee appreciation" event, but all they did was raise the price.
- When Starbucks started giving away a free mp3 with each purchase, ING Cafe did the same with CD's.
- I can never decide what to order because they offer too many options.
- When I dropped my $4 cappuccino, it bounced.
author: Sven E.

description: I love this place. Everybody is so attentive and super nice. Half off discount on coffee. I'm happy...
author: Nara E.

description: The space is awesome, I've been back 3 times in a week. the drinks are just okay, but then again, they're super cheap.
author: May G.

description: This must be the coolest marketing trick I have seen from a bank. This place is a nice spacious coffee shop with free wifi, local food, and the baristas are bankers! Go figure...
author: Greg S.

description: cheap coffee but the people who work here need to chill out with trying to get me to sign up for a checking/savings account. They literally ask every time i visit.
author: Dan S.

description: I LOVE the ING Direct cafe!  Great cafe, great environment and great staff!  The atmosphere and location is perfect.  The coffee is amazing and at a great price. Can't wait to see what else they bring to San Francisco!
author: Emily S.

description:
Great place to get some work done,
it has a very businessy and sterile vibe to it though.
author: Thomas B.

description: This became my favorite "coffee shop" near work as soon as it opened. They always have ample space (and three levels), you can get a cup of tea for $1.50, and there's never a wait. I once asked if they had a tip jar and they responded "no, we try to encourage you to save money." So corny, I love it!
author: Adam D.

description: Yay cheap coffee and a nice place to get free wi-fi.  Bring your electric orange card and get half off!
author: Kris B.

description: I use this space every day to meet with my team. Great alternative to working from home. Why would you pay to use a co-working space when there are options like this available?? Thanks, Capital One!
author: Marcus K.

description: Huge open space with solid coffee and friendly service.  If you need a place to relax or get a bit of work done, I highly recommend this spot.  Really cool concept!
author: David A.

description: Great place to hang out and work. Cheap, friendly service and free wifi.
author: Zari Z.

description: Union Square has a decided lack of clean coffeeshops with wifi. Although this whole place is a commercial for an internet bank it really meets my needs. I feel a little silly that I discovered it just today, but definitely will return.
author: Cameron K.

description: I love this place ever since they opened. Ventured my way in on the day it opened and found out that a large ice coffee was $1.50 and I was hooked. The cheapest Iced coffee the city and they use Peets. In addition the space is fantastic to use for networking, meetings, freelance work. And I'm not just using their space, I think the space works for them too. I opened up a Roth IRA account and reopened my previous savings account there. So it goes to show when a Bank does more than just own empty space in the city it's more effect than other places (how I feel every time I walk into Wells Fargo).
author: Daniel K.

description: Whoever conceived this idea, I believe may be on to something! They have non-gimmicky fool-proof accounts, and they try to inform you of their services by luring you into a cool multitiered workspace with a coffeeshop, pastries, free wifi, plug points, varied seating with bean bags up to stools, segwaying to their clean bathrooms; even cute girls on occasion-a winning place to get some work done!
author: Vivek N.

description: I finally made it to the ING Direct cafe. I heard about it a while back and could not find it.  The location is pretty large with plenty of seating and TVs. There is an ING ATM in the cafe - great concept. I will definitely plan to drop by when I am in the area.
author: Ana C.

description:
When you're an online bank, why have an offline presence? 

Because you make that offline presence into a brilliant cafe, that's why! Cheap coffee & snacks, huge space, fast wi-fi & tons of plug points. What's *not* to love?

Edit: speedtest tells me: 40 mbps down, 30 mbps up. And that's in the middle of the day, with probably 40-odd people logged on.
author: KS S.

description: Amazing staff and great space! Too bad the Peets baristas always get my orders wrong....
author: Evie K.

description: This place is like hanging out at a venture funded startup with money to burn. The wifi is fast and unlimited (purchase to access). There are three floors with multiple environments to choose from (work standing up, sitting down, on a couch, at a work bench, at your own table). There are plugs everywhere. It's super spacious with high ceilings. This is great space to work or meet people for work. The food and coffee are just ok though, but it's so reasonably priced, you can't hold that against them. Also, be aware, the music is pretty random and the acoustics make for a constant din so bring your headphones if you can't work like that. Lastly, the staff here are super duper friendly, always. I don't know why ING has a cafe, but I really like the effort. As a one time ING Direct account holder, I'm kind of proud.
author: Ramon S.

description: inexpensive drinks and goodies and awesome co working space, loving this spot!
author: Tiff W.

description: I signed up for a capital one 360 account. They did not honor the promotion that was advertised and customer service was terrible. Don't recommend for banking.
author: Henry K.

description: I like the spaciousness of the place, and the food is pretty good too! I just don't like the "do you have an account with us" talk from the staff, but hey what do you expect it is a cafe in a bank after all.
author: Christina S.

description: I've been working here everyday for the past two months, and it's a life-saver. I don't know how they make any money off this cafe. My only guess is marketing and building brand equity. Coffee/tea for $0.75 for Capital One members, $75-$125 credit if you open an account, free wi-fi, tons of outlets, cool vibe, great energy. Lots of freelancers and start-ups work from here. The staff is friendly and the place is clean!
author: F S.

description: Nice people at the front. Good music at the perfect volume. Open area with tables and couches. Basically a great place to get work done alone or in a group. Oh yeah, let's not forget the free wifi.
author: Jane K.

description: Seriously, where else can you get a soy vanilla latte for $1.75?!  This is the best place for your coffee break without a huge dent in your wallet.  The staff is super friendly, although there is this one guy who seems way too caffeinated.  Food is also cheap - $2 fruit cup (although I wish they would cut the fruit into bigger pieces).
author: SJ W.

description:
food/drink: very affordable. good coffee. super friendly baristas.
atmostpher: lots of natural light, free wifi, three floors of open seating (couches, tables, high-top tables), ample outlets. great place for studying/meetings!
author: Jennifer C.

description: okay people..... first and foremost.... this is a BANK.... not a cafe... the cafe part is an extra bonus and so is their free wi-fi.... amazing place to bank and end up hanging out at my bank b/c it also has a cafe and I can breakfast and lunch here as well... from time to time they will have promotions.... and I love that they promote a lot of the local business.... free hotdogs, free bbq lunch, free waffles for breakfast.... right now they r displaying work of a local artist... who uses a flat screen as a canvas... how awesome is that... you have to see it.... Now the banking part, these bankers are all about service... they are friendly, happy and very HELPFUL. They will go above and beyond  to help you sort out your accounts if you need. And they love telling about their promotions...i.e. $50 bonus for opening a checking account and I only needed $5.00 to do that.... I already made $50.00... how great is this.... Thanks Capital One (on Post) for such a fun way to bank!
author: Jay S.

description: Perfect environment representing all thats good with SF
author: Nader S.

description: Pretty smart idea.  They advertise by opening a Starbucks-like coffee lounge while trying to get you exposed to their product.  The sales-person wasn't too pushy either.  Their latte was super strong!
author: Steven C.
